overview: This is a standard ibis hotel, despite its name not really close to the Plaza Glories. Of note is the fact that no twin rooms are offered, only doubles.

name: Tuolumne Meadows
overview: The Tuolumne Meadows campground is open from July through September and offers 50% of its sites as reservation only, while 50% are first-come, first-served.  304 sites are available for both tents and RVs up to 35' in length.  Be prepared for chilly night-time temperatures.  Water and flush toilets are available.

name: Red Hostel
overview: A hostel set in a renovated colonial home built in 1912. Typical hostel traffic, but very nice staff who like to hang out with their friends late at night on the hostel roof.

name: D'Lagoon
address: in the bay of the same name, north of Long Beach
overview: Wooden chalets with mosquito nets, and own restaurant with reasonable prices. Good food, quiet place with private beach. Coral is right in the bay but so close you cut yourself in low tide. Possible to walk from Long beach (1h), see [[#Get_around|''Get around'' section]]. 24 hour electricity, WiFi available.

name: Goomakad Cottage and Rakkar Information Center
overview: Eco friendly mud cottages built and run by Mohinder, a friendly Gaddi shepherd from the village. Simple rooms with attached bathrooms and cooking facilities if required. Wifi available. Mohinder also arranges home stays with the local families and can give information on the various trekking trails from Rakkar.

name: Sunbird Ku Chawe Inn
overview: Clearly signposted from Zomba town. Situated at the top of the plateau with stunning views. $80-$100 for a double room including breakfast.

name: 8 Dyer Hotel
overview: Award-winning contemporary boutique guesthouse in the east end. Features 7 rooms with air conditioning, robes, some with balconies. The hotel has a pool (which is rare for guesthouses here), jacuzzi and sauna; bikes are available to borrow. As a chef-owned B&B, the breakfast features local produce at a large buffet that includes fresh-baked items and eggs to order. Friendly innkeepers set a fun, upscale, relaxed tone.

name: Batumi Hilton
overview: Still under construction in 2014 but looks very promising.

name: Onni
overview: The name means "happiness", and this charming small hotel in the heart of old Porvoo (the building was built in 1840) was boutique before they invented the word.  Four rooms decorated in various retro styles from ''Functional'' (as in the 1920s architectural movement) to ''Manor''.  Breakfast included.

name: Tentsuku Guest House
overview: Small guest house with shared tatami rooms only.

name: Ruissalo Spa
overview: Ruissalo Spa is located and named after the scenic Ruissalo Island, which is situated right next to central Turku. The spa is located by the sea and you can choose to swim on the pools or in the sea as well. The location is beautiful and there's a golf course and guest harbor right next to the hotel. Beware though: This is the favorite location for elderly locals, so if you're looking for something more youth-oriented, this might not be the place for you.

name: Curry Village
overview: [[File:Handicap reverse blue background.svg|15px|frameless]] Located in Yosemite Valley, Curry Village offers a wide range of lodging options ranging from "hotel" accommodations to tent cabins.  Be aware that tent cabins and some wooden cabins are primitive and do not have private baths.  There are five bathroom buildings and one shower building in the camp. No cooking is allowed at Curry Village and tent cabins also come with a bear locker to store food. There is an outdoor pool, which is free to people lodging there and open to the public for $5.  There are two cabins, one hotel room, and six canvas tent cabins that are accessible. '''As of November 2008, one-third of the cabins are permanently off-limits due to rock slide concerns. Reserve early!'''

name: Orpington House Bed and Breakfast
overview: Has just one bedroom. Located 20 minutes drive outside of Christchurch city.

name: Peter Shields Inn & Restaurant
overview: The Peter Shields Inn is a 1907 Georgian Revival mansion, a Bed and Breakfast Diamond Collection boutique inn with 9 guest rooms, oceanfront views, a front porch, bike rentals, and a restaurant.

name: Hotel Katharinenhof
overview: Also offers holiday apartments. Free wi-fi in lobby, minimum stay 3 days. Also operates [http://www.palabra.at/ ''Palabra''], a Spanish wine bar (M T F 18:00-)

name: Valley Hostel
overview: Tel &, . Cheap, homely and the hosts are sound. Set in the heart of the Valley, just up the road from the train station and minutes from Staubbach Falls. Dorm: CHF 25 (bargain).

name: Prodigy Outdoor base
overview: Prodigy outdoor base is so-named because it considers itself less a hotel in the forest and more a base from which to explore, get involved in outdoor sports or just enjoy nature and then relax with friends and family, enjoying fresh food from the kitchen cooked by local farmers and drinks from the bar. Located in Houwu Village just outside the designated Moganshan Scenic Area, no Moganshan entrance ticket is required. Bikes are available to hire and the base can organise activities tailored to your group.

name: Hotel Arca Torre Roppongi
overview: Also super centrally located at Roppongi Crossing, with small but acceptable rooms (the cheap ones are without daylight)

name: Railay Great View Resort
address: Rai Leh East. Walk past the Last Bar, a 10 min walk, adequately lit at night
overview: Tucked away on its own away from the hustle and bustle. Gorgeous views with very well designed cottages with a mix of traditional and modern design. Free Wi-Fi throughout resort. Restaurant and mini-mart onsite. Restaurant does not serve alcohol. Room rate includes buffet breakfast (reasonably good variety and quality). Very steep incline up into the resort so not for aged, infirm, or tipsy!

name: Stray Possum Lodge
overview: Backpacker hostel with bar & restaurant. A little rough and ready, but a good setup in a great location.

name: Melia Luxembourg
overview: The Melia enjoys a location right beside the MUDAM in the Quartier Europeene Sud and is an interesting work of modern architecture both outside and on the wholesome inside.

name: Hotell Kristina
overview: A hotel.

name: Kavalto Farm
overview: An alternative to the city hotels, Kavalto Farm offers bed and breakfast in Finnish countryside

name: K+K Hotel George
overview: 154 rooms and free wireless (and wired) internet access. The hotel is also right next door to Earl's Court exhibition center.

name: Nightingale Hostel
overview: At Famous Slaveykov Square/center of the downtown/, a non-smoking eco hostel provides not only beds/rooms but it is a social place with air-conditioning, common/TV room and lobby area. Free of charge- breakfast, kitchen, PC and WiFi internet, lockers, maps, call a taxi, book a club, check timetables service, hot showers in renovated and sexes separated toilets and 24h reception desk. Laundry, pick up, meals and drinks are available. Friendly and talkative staff. A lot of info for local life.

name: The Rabbit Hole Guest House & Restaurant
overview: The Rabbit Hole Guest House & Restaurant offers 17 beautiful rooms, all of which have en-suite bathrooms, private balconies with separate entrances and free wi-fi internet access. From the Rabbit Hole it is a short (200m) and pleasant walk to a wide variety of shops and restaurants at the Key West Shopping Centre. The restaurants are all situated on the waterfront of the Pretorius Park Dam. The Rabbit Hole has large gardens, ample safe parking space and an on-site restaurant that offers a charmingly surreal eating experience.

name: The Haus on Mirror Lake
overview: Stainless steel kitchens, Jacuzzi tubs, 38in. flat screen TV’s, view of the High Peaks. No pets, restrictive cancellation policy.

name: Hôtel des Voyageurs
overview: Just across the street from the '''Regina''', and offering rooms of a similar quality.

name: AMA Hotel
overview: This small airport and trade fair hotel with only 4 apparments is located in the center of town, close to restaurants and sights. Free parking is available. As the hotel has no maned reception, automated check-in is available 24/7. The rooms are spacious and modern and free wifi is available.

name: Camping la Sorguette
overview: Rental locations for tents places , mobile homes, but also yurt, tent lodge and tipi.

name: Villa Klio
overview: A two bedroom holiday villa with private pool and sea views to Sfinari bay

name: Polonia Palace Hotel
overview: Luxury hotel in the center of Warsaw. Police warn to watch out for prostitutes that congregate in the area and occasionally approach guests in order to take advantage of the wealthier travelers.

name: Gajapuri Resort and Spa
overview: Bungalows on the beach.

name: Castille Paris
overview: In the fashion district of Paris, the Castille Paris offers chic rooms that all look out onto the Rue Cambon. Some rooms are designed in a "Coco Chanel" style with beige and black tones.

name: Hotel Grameen
overview: A big hotel on busy Nawabpur Rd, just south of Bangsal Rd.

name: Artisan Hotel
overview: A small non-gaming boutique hotel, popular among younger crowds seeking a vibrant night scene.

name: Five Elements Hostel
overview: Clean and new facilities with English and German speaking staff. Offers variation from dorms to single rooms. Free WLAN

name: Alpenpark
overview: Quality hotel and holiday apartments with breakfast.

name: Dover Hotel Milan
overview: Thirteen single, double/twin and triple accommodations with en-suites services, internet connections, TV and telephone.

name: Wakayama Kada Onsen Kada Kaigetsu
overview: An onsen hot spring hotel with a panoramic view of the Kitan Channel. Enjoy the beauty of the setting sun.

name: Scandic Hotel Plaza
overview: Hotel Scandic Plaza enjoys a central location in the heart of the city and is close to popular Turku attractions. Its situated in the city centre, close to Market Square and the pedestrian zone full of stores. Hansa shopping centre and Stockmann department store are also situated opposite the hotel. There's also a 24-hour gym and wind down with a relaxing sauna and you can borrow a bicycle from the hotel reception or enjoy dinner in the hotel restaurant.

name: Simplon Youth Hotel
overview: This youth hostel has been around for a long time and remains a popular budget puck. Bunk-beds starting at €13,50. Rooms for up to 6 people are available, too.

name: Best Western Nova Hotell Kurs og Konferanse
overview: As the name reveals, it is also a conference center with a large number of conference rooms. The hotel reception is on the 4th floor, the rooms on the 5th and 6th - you need to take an elevator up there. On the bottom floor there is a movie theater. The rooms seem to have been recently renovated, and as pretty much any mid-range hotel, they include bathroom and tv and there's free wi-fi. Breakfast is included in the rates. In addition to this you can fry your own Norwegian-style waffles on the 4th floor in the evening between 18 and 21. On the downside, on nights with live music in the pub in the same building you will hear the music in your room too, whether you want it or not.

name: Hotel Anabela
overview: 383 rooms, five suites. Rooms all with blcony, bath, telephone, TV, minibar. Air conditioning in the suites.  Hotel open: 17 Apr – 12 Oct

name: Staybridge Suites
overview: A rare occurrence of IHG's extended-stay brand outside of North America, the Staybridge Suites Birmingham offers studios and apartments with kitchenettes and other long-stay facilities, including on-site gym. Breakfasts are included in room rates.

name: Two Lotti Villa Medicinal Pension
overview: Reception, wheelchair access rooms, catering (breakfast on site and delivery), sports training site, family event venue, BBQ Facilities,manicure and pedicure (by appointment), massage, guarded parking, sauna, social games, naturopath, courses, Wi-Fi/ WLAN, high chair for babies

name: Pleasure Bay Resort
overview: Chalets are all built on the highest dunes and all have sea views overlooking the bay “Baia Das Correntes”, which is protected by the “Lighthouse” Reef.

name: Lidia Hotel and Restaurant
overview: A three star wellness hotel with garden and restaurant. There are 37 rooms with two beds

name: Bladok Losmen & Restaurant
overview: Bladok Losmen & Restaurant is a small hotel with clean and comfortable rooms, traditionally designed. All rooms have a private bathroom attached. Rooms with a balcony are available. Double room with fan & hot shower Rp 140,000. A basic room is about Rp 100,000.

name: Manta Lodge and Scuba Centre
overview: The lodge belongs to YHA and offers dormitory accommodation and also has a double room and a twin room. This is a 5-star PADI dive center and resort that offers scuba diving trips and courses. It also offers snorkelling, 4WD tours, surfing and kayaking.

name: ibis budget Jakarta Daan Mogot
overview: A great option hotel for budget travelers from the Ibis brand, 10 minutes away from Taman Anggrek Mall. Modest amenities in rooms with colorful interior, the triple option includes a double bed and a bunk bed above it.

name: Days Inn
overview: A three star hotel near PAF and Naval museum.

name: I due Roccoli
overview: From this hotel you can have a beautiful view on Lake Iseo.

name: Holiday Inn Philadelphia
overview: Free Wi-Fi access, 24-hour business center and flexible meeting rooms.  Game room, kiddie pool and sparkling outdoor pool.

name: Seven Olives Hotel
overview: The oldest hotel in Lalibela, founded in 1967 and badly in need of a freshening makeover, this dilapidated property is owned by the diocesan office. Rooms are noisily close, clean, small and dark, with twins, double and triple beds and small en suite ablutions with hot showers. Substantially over-priced at 680 birr for single occupancy, dbl/twin 910 birr, triple 1280 birr. Cash only. However, it has the best hygiene of the central hotels and has a peaceful garden with mature trees and one of the best restaurants in town.

name: Golden Gate Hotel and Casino
overview: Originally opened in 1906 under the name ''Hotel Nevada'', this is the oldest casino hotel in Las Vegas.

name: Commodore Hotel
overview: The biggest hotel in town with rooms from £55. Refurbished in about 2004. On the sea front about 1/2 mile from the town centre.

name: Hotel De Utrechtsche Dom
overview: Characteristic family hotel in the centre of Gouda. Breakfast included.

name: Hotel Rex
overview: The Hotel Rex was inspired by the San Francisco art and literary salons of the 1920s and 30s. The clubby lobby surrounds guests with distinctive period furnishings, walls of antiquarian books, and a collection of exotic objects, original portraits and murals.

name: Minshuku Toube
overview: A comfortable and clean guesthouse. Each room has a TV, a ''kotatsu'', tea cups and hot water, and futons for sleeping. The common room has maps of the island, free wireless internet, coffee and tea, and a large ''manga'' collection. Only Japanese is spoken.

name: Belceğiz
overview: This is just a single stone-built dwelling that belongs to an old shepherd who lives there just sometimes. The place around the dwelling though is very good for camping and has also fireplaces. During the night though it might become humid and cold. The only water source there — a cistern — is drinkable if purified or boiled before usage.

name: B.R. Hotel
overview: Simple, but cosy Thai hotel. Fan rooms are often sold out, however 299 baht for an air-con room with TV and small balcony is an excellent value during hot or wet season. No Wi-Fi (but Truemove 850 MHz 3G works perfectly). While the hotel is not far from the centre, the closest place where you can catch a public songthaew (near Kad Suan Kaew Mall) is almost 1 km away, so the place is better suited for those who rent a motorbike. Free parking. On the nearby intersection with Hasadhisawee Rd, there are numerous and cheap food stalls in the evening. Hotel staff generally doesn't speak any English. If no vacancy, there's Inthanon Hotel next on the same road, priced ~50 baht more.

name: Chave Douro
overview: A basic hostel with rooms for 1-2. Located in the center. You can bargain the price if you stay more than a few days.

name: Khutir Hotel
overview: 19 r./38 beds

name: Holiday Inn Golden Gateway Hotel
overview: A Holiday Inn with more amenities than the typical location and nice views of the city.

name: Cumberland Point Campground
overview: A campground operated by the US Army Corps of Engineers located on the shore of Lake Cumberland. The campground offers 30 sites with electric hook ups. Amenities include shower houses, a boat ramp, and playground. The operating season is May though September.

name: Agota
overview: Cheap choice of accommodation for up to 50 persons, offers singles, doubles and triples. All rooms are equipped with free wireless internet.

name: Embassy Suites Denver Southeast
overview: Near Denver Tech, hotel offers complimentary hot cooked-to-order breakfast and nightly Manager's Reception featuring complimentary cocktails and appetizers.

name: Hotel Kara
overview: Built in 1974 and a little bit run-down, but the best place to sleep in Kara. Singles from 18500 FCFA, doubles from 21500 FCFA. Dinner is 6000 FCFA and worth the price.

name: Lydmar Hotel
overview: A five-star hotel, and a terrace bar with view of the Palace and the National Museum.

name: Mosaic House
overview: A unique blend of 4* hotel and hostel. Downstairs, the restaurant and bar have a wide variety of local and international food and drink options. It's a blend of style, ecofriendly features, fun, and culture for all ages. Prices range from 250Kč for a shared room and 1,400Kč for a private double. Modern, eco-friendly, and centrally located. From shared rooms to private rooms with terraces, all are beautifully designed with cozy linens, gorgeous bathrooms, modern amenities. Also on premises is Belushi's Bar and Restaurant [http://www.belushis.com/], which offers great food and drinks and live entertainment. Breakfast is served from 7am through 11:30am, with omelettes and scrambled eggs, pancakes and fresh fruits, fresh breads from their local bakery, coffee and tea. Lunch, dinner, late night eats, and everything in between served until 11pm. You can select from burgers and sandwich options galore, tasty salads, filling appetizers and specialty desserts menu.

name: Spicy House
overview: Perhaps the friendliest little guest house in Chiang Mai. Beloved by backpackers everywhere for its low cost and friendly atmosphere. Mim, the owner, gives a free meal for guests every night. She is also an expert chef, and Spicy House serves as a cooking school sometimes. Spicy House is in the dead centre of the Chiang Mai action, but down a quiet soi where you can withdraw from it when needed.

name: Lochboisdale Hotel
overview: Good bar meals in the evening.

name: Comfort Inn
overview: has 121 rooms and is a couple of miles from the Morton Arboretum in [[Lisle]] as well as I-88 and I-355.

name: Hotel Melantrich
overview: Comfortably equipped fully en-suite rooms.

name: Revonsaari Camping
overview: Tent and caravan/camper spots and a large cottage.

name: Mantra Geraldton
overview: Sitting atop the stunning Champion Bay Marina, Mantra Geraldton is within a short walk of Geraldton’s Central Business District and the popular local Maritime Museum. Comprising 24 spacious one, two, three bedroom room apartments, Mantra Geraldton provides comfortable and stylish accommodation which includes a fully-equipped kitchen, laundry and spacious lounge and dining areas. Internet access and ISD/STD direct dial phones are also available in-room along with a host of amenities to make your stay more comfortable. Mantra Geraldton is also located close to excellent cafés and restaurants.

name: Mahadev Guest House
overview: An enviable location near the major shopping and business area geared up for backpacker travellers.

name: Hotel Begolli
overview: An exceptionally clean family-owned boutique hotel with five fully furnished self-contained apartments and eleven rooms. Apartments have kitchens and well appointed amenities and one suite has a full sized jacuzzi spa. Some other rooms have private jacuzzis or three beds for families.

name: Buena Vista
overview: Campsite with a wonderful view, even has a shower! There is cooked food available as well.

name: Paraiso Lodge
overview: Nice lodge in Oasis de Sangalle with a pool, volleyball field and hammocks. Small restaurant on site, with set menu for dinner for 15 soles.

name: Hotel Suites Mexico Plaza
overview: Somewhat distant from the main city (around 20-25 minutes on a cab). Taxis from the airport are by no way cheap, around 20 USD, and transportation to downtown is around $5USD. Free wi-fi.

name: Friend Street Hostel
overview: Internet terminals, free wifi, free breakfast, towel rental, security lockers, luggage storage, 24 hour access.

name: Staybridge Suites
overview: Free high-speed Internet, continental breakfast, business indoor pool and fitness center. On Tuesday-Thursday evenings enjoy free beer, wine, soft drinks and a light meal.

name: Selang Resort
overview: Boutique hotel with sea-views from each of 14 rooms. Has a restaurant and a swimming pool with bar. Singles, doubles and a 2 room family bungalow. Deep Blue Dive is attached.

name: Naantali Spa Hotel
overview: Finland's largest spa with roots dating back to the 18th century, even the Russian Czar has paid a visit. The resort includes a multitude of restaurants, a variety of rooms and large spa, beauty and pool services. The spa is the only Scandinavian member in the Royal Spas of Europe - affiliation. The resort is also well known in Scandinavia for arranging conferences.

name: Hotel Frederiksdal
overview: Conference hotel in a striking white building from the 60s - and with 60 rooms, all with a beautiful view over the Mølleå river and green surroundings. Extra amenities include table tennis, billiards, sauna and a bar.

name: Wonderfully Wild
overview: luxury camping in canvas lodges

name: Lord Nelson Hotel
overview: <br> 29 rooms

name: Hilton Budapest City
overview: Glued to the WestEnd shopping centre, the Hilton is a fairly predictable affair, without the historic charm of its sister property in Buda, but delivering solid value.

name: Hostel Cat
overview: Basic accommodations. Laundry and kitchen facilities, free pancake breakfast, wi-fi, some private rooms, lots of social activities.

name: Brampton Bed and Breakfast Inn
overview: Bed and breakfast on a 19'th century luxury estate set on 25 landscaped acres. Pet Friendly rooms available.

name: Shees Hotel
overview: Centrally located. The rooms are a good value, and the manager is helpful.

name: Guesthouse LT
overview: Comfortable, family run guesthouse with outstanding value for money also offers breakfast. 4 rooms.

name: Former County Court Palace
overview: Built in 1908–1909. - Now here is the Transcarpathian Hungarian Pedagogical Institute

name: Raddus Hotel
overview: A three  star hotel

name: Lubd Bangkok
overview: This hostel was designed by famous hotel designers. It offers 8-bed dormitories, ladies-only dormitories, private rooms for 1-2 people and normal double bed hotel rooms with a private bathroom. All rooms are clean, comfortable and have air conditioning. There's a TV room, free Wi-Fi and free use of the nine internet terminals and luggage storage. There are do-it-yourself laundry services for around 60 baht. The colourful bar offers breakfast, snacks and beverages until midnight (2 beers for 100 baht). Booking is cheaper if done via the web compared to just walking in.

name: Hotel Claris
overview: All of the 24 rooms are equipped with shower/bath, WC, hair dryer, sat TV, IDD telephone with voice mail, safe and free Wi-Fi.

name: Old Faithful Inn
overview: A national historic site, this rustic hotel was originally constructed entirely of logs during the winter of 1903. The original 120 rooms were expanded with the addition of the east wing in 1913, and the west wing was added in 1927. Major renovations were done from 2004 - 2008 to improve infrastructure and shore up the building's supports while also reverting some past modifications to bring the inn closer to its original design. Today it is the largest log hotel in the world, and the vast lobby incorporates large tree trunks as pillars and a stone fireplace. Accommodations range from rooms with shared bathrooms and showers nearby to suites with private bathrooms and refrigerators. Open from mid-May through mid-October.

name: Hani Guesthouse
overview: Aimed at younger travellers. A hotel like atmosphere with all the usual amenities like a communual kitchen/lounge area, washing facilities, PCs, WiFi.

name: Hotel Silken Concordia
overview: On a major street. The metro station "Poble Sec" is right across from the hotel. If you prefer to walk you can reach "La Rambla" and all the major atrractions in downtown Barcelona in just 15 minutes. The rooms are spacious, the furniture is almost like new, and the staff are quite friendly.

name: InterCity Hotel Düsseldorf
overview: Next to the main station, easy access to all sightseeing spots. Newly opened.

name: Las Chullpas Eco Lodge
overview: Great place to enjoy in quietness all the great surroundings in the Sacred Valley.

name: Hostel Portobelo and Captain Jack's Canopy Bar
overview: Hostel Portobelo features dormitories, private rooms, bar and restaurant. Located 2 min walk from the center of town.  Up the hill with a great view over the bay.

name: Hotel Bayerischer Hof
overview: One of the grand old dames in Munich, the hotel's splendor and facilities reflect the personal management of the Volkhardt family who have owned the hotel for four generations. It boasts a pool well positioned on the top floor alongside a gym and spa bar. Rooms are calm and spacious with big double beds, flat screen TVs and a sitting area. The large bathrooms have a private phone and plenty of shelf space, with a shower-tub combination. Rooms are furnished with both modern and traditional pieces, marble, antiques and art decorated plentifully, and you can dine at any one of the three fabulous restaurants. Rates include champagne breakfast.

name: Hostelling International Newburg
overview: Open March through November.

name: Okura Hotel
overview: Inside Act Tower.

name: Koehlers Guest House
overview: Family guest house, with restaurant.

name: Hotel Le M
overview: The hotel offers 59 fully renovated, comfortable and soundproofed rooms, in an elegant designer setting.

name: Hashorva Guesthouse
overview: for info and booking. The Hashorva Family, a well established name in the Lagjia Varosh Neighborhood, offering one very large, faithfully restored traditional Ottoman Era room, with a double bed and sitting area.  The house itself is over 200 years old and is kept in wonderful condition by its original owners.  Naturally cool in the summer, the guest bathroom is located off the main hallway with 24 hour hot water and modern facilities.  Located in the heart of Gjirokastër, an easy 5 to 15 minutes walk from all the major sites of Historic Old Town and 10 minutes walk to the new town and the Bus station on the National Road.  The large guest room is €20/night - it has a large double bed, a single bed off to the side. (''Payment can be made by cash only in Albanian lek, Euros or US Dollars - Or you can book in advance online using a credit card at [http://www.hostelworld.com/]'')

name: The Hillbark Hotel
overview: Grade II listed hotel provides the finest luxury coupled with discreet yet friendly service from the resident owners and their team.

name: General Hitchcock Campground
overview: Not recommended for trailers or RVs. No water, vault toilets.

name: Yasaka Saigon-NhaTrang Hotel
overview: Japanese/Vietnamese hotel. Service here is very friendly, and it has all the amenities you would need. It is just walking distance to the beach.

name: The Royal City Hotel
overview: This is a decent hotel near Central Plaza Pinklao. Rooms are spacious, comfortable and clean, but also quite old, dark and uninspiring. Facilities are plentiful, including a pool, fitness and massage. The staff are really nice and helpful. There is not that much to do in the area, except for the nearby 7-Eleven.

name: Ana Mari Hotel
overview: Simplistic hotel run by friendly owner. It occupies the first floor of a 5-storey building. A bit rundown but very cheap.

name: Lindner Hotel Am Belvedere
overview: Surprisingly tasteful, with large rooms, oversized beds and very reasonable pricing - and next to the Belvedere gardens indeed. You can get airline miles with many frequent flier programmes by staying at Lindner hotels.

name: Hotel-Grand Café De Wijnberg
overview: Located right on the town square, this is the biggest and most centrally located hotel in Bolsward.

name: Almos hotel
overview: Services: Sauna & Swimming pool, Billiards & Table tennis, Fitness saloon, Professional masseuse's services, Fully equiped conference-room, Wi-Fi Internet, Disco-bar with variety of beverages, Transportation services, Dry cleaning and storing the luggage, Reservation and obtainment of tickets

name: Georgian Hotel
overview: The Georgian Hotel is an Art Deco classic that dates back to the 1920s.  Located right on Ocean Avenue and in the heart of downtown Santa Monica, it is in the thick of the action.  Rooms are smaller and prices are not cheap, but it is a great place to stay.

name: Villa Fontaine Ueno
overview: Mid-range hotel. Rooms have en-suite toilet. Staff speaks English. Simple breakfast included. Free internet (through LAN cable) in rooms. Rooms are quiet and pleasant. 5 minutes walk from Shin-Okachimachi Station.

name: Vila Predelut
overview: Six rooms with individual bathroom with shower and double size beds, with hotel-type linen and TV cable with TV LCD screen. Every room has a balcony with view to Bucegi Mountains or Magura Branului Hill and from the terrace you can see the Dracula Castle. The property has also a nice garden with a garden kiosk. Continental breakfast and if more then three rooms are booked they offer a rich breakfast buffet. Free wireless internet.

name: Best Western City Hotel Gouda
overview: Modern hotel with 101 rooms, part of the Best Western chain, but conveniently and nicely located in the historic centre.

name: Salalah Marriott Resort
overview: A 4-star resort. Day use packages including use of the pool and towels cost OMR10, and snorkel and diving gear can be rented from the on-site dive centre.

name: Hotel Pension Rotdorn
overview: Ideal for visitors of the fairground. Small and reasonably priced hotel with large garden and wonderful ambiance.

name: Four Points by Sheraton München Olympiapark
overview: With large spacious rooms and currently undergoing renovations to increase the quality of the hotel to four stars. The staff is attentive and speaks good English.

name: Nells Park
overview: About 2 miles out of Trier, easily accessible by bus, and as the name suggests, within a park. All rooms are individually decorated and in varying states of renovation (ask for a new one).  Parking was a bit tight, but plenty of parking on the road next to the hotel. Excellent food too.

name: Kamerdiner Hotel
overview: Small cosy hotel- Seven rooms in lavishly restored former mansion looking onto monastery, very friendly service and attentive staff. Continental breakfast, Wifi, satellite TV, fridge, safe, air-conditioning, 24-hour security, visa support, theatre bookings, guided tours, airport transfer.

name: R. Penjor Lodge
overview: Centrally located. Clean and pleasant rooms with attached bathroom, cable TV and wifi. Restaurant and coffee shop facilities (upstairs from Ambient Cafe, run by same people).

name: Radisson Blu Béke Hotel
overview: Services: Free High-speed Internet, Room Service, Pets Allowed, Suites. +phone=+36 1 889 3923

name: Hotel Casa Fuster
overview: Hotel Casa Fuster's Barcelona accommodation offers 105 rooms. The stunningly beautiful, iconic 19th century building is located at the head of the chic Passeig de Gracia Avenue. It has a roof terrace with a pool and excellent views.

name: Pier 2620 Hotel Fisherman's Wharf
overview: Non-smoking hotel.

name: Alum Ford Campground
address: 7 miles west of Whitley City, Kentucky
overview: A campground operated by the National Park Service and located within the Big South Fork National Recreation Area. Alum Ford consists of 6 primitive campsites on the shore of Lake Cumberland. There is no source of potable water and any water drawn from the lake needs to be purified.  Sites cost 5 dollars per night and are available on a first come first serve basis.  The campground has a boat ramp, pit toilets and is open year round.

name: Tan yr Eglwys Cottages
overview: 2 self catering cottages,  sleeping 6 and 4-5 respectively.  Located in a very quiet hamlet, above the Swansea and Neath Valleys.  4* graded cottages, free Wi Fi, off road parking, cycle storage.  15 minutes from the M4 at Neath or Swansea.

name: Sleep-in Green
overview: This place you can crash in the rather spartan bunk beds, and do your bit for the evironment - with 2nd hand furtiture, organic breakfast, and toilets flushing in rainwater etc. Open from May to the end of October.

name: The Hub Hostel Kyiv
overview: A hostel in a freestanding building in the center with a huge yard. Privates and 4-12 bed dorms, including female only dorms; free Wi-Fi, linen, tea and coffee. A 24-hour reception, free lockers. Big, soundproof social area with variety of board games, movies and books, well-equipped kitchen. Different activities every day of the week: movie nights, guided tours, pub crawling. Can accommodate groups and provide lodging for all sorts of events.

name: Saidaiji Grande Hotel
overview: Located in the quieter Saidaiji area of the city, it is ideal for those who don't wish to stay in the inner city, those who want to explore sites along the Ako Line, and anyone planning to attend or participate in the Saidaiji Eyo. Book well in advance for the festival.

name: Station House Caravan Park
overview: Campground with a local pub nearby.

name: Al Salam Rotana
overview: Opened in mid 2007, this is the only hotel in Khartoum that offers international five-star standard. Nice big rooms, perfectly equipped. Pool, gym, restaurant and lobby bar, conference facilities and Wifi (fee).

name: The Duchess of Wellington
overview: Victorian 1844 mansion originally owned by Alexander McLean, first mayor of Chatham.

name: Nazary Four Star Hotel
overview: Walatay St. +93(0)799 351899, +93(0)795 606400. A new Dubai-esque tower block on the main east-west street. Rack rates are around $60 for an en suite double but discounts are available. Rooms have a/c, heating, satellite TV and LAN internet.

name: Regent Plaza Hotel & Convention Centre.
overview: A hotel offering high end facilities (Airport transfer via Shuttle, Welcome Drink upon arrival, Fruit Basket upon arrival, In room safe, Local Morning Newspaper of your choice delivered in room, Buffet Break Fast, Health Club Facilities and Usage of Swimming Pool, WIFI connectivity in Room and through out hotel) along with generous-sized rooms at the bottom end of the price range. Have three floors, Standard, Executive and Deluxe. Suite Room at Executive floor. Suit rooms and Deluxe rooms have other than facilities mentioned above Tea/Coffee maker in room, Evening turn down service, large mineral water bottle, free Laundry Service, and Dry Fruit Platter and sweets/Chocolate Platter in room.

name: Hyatt Regency Da Nang
address: Truong Sa St, Hoa Hai Ward, Ngu Hanh Son District
overview: 200 comfortable rooms and 27 ocean-view villas.

name: Koti Onnela
overview: Youth Hostel.

name: Hotel Alpha-1 Matsue
overview: Rooms have basic amenities and LAN internet.

name: Hotel Rosmunda
overview: The same owners of the castle, you can organize conference in it contacting this hotel.

name: Savoy Homann
overview: Bandung's oldest hotel and one-time host to Charlie Chaplin, Yasser Arafat, and the delegation of the 1955 Asia-African Conference. The current building is a striking art-deco work from the 1930s,  perfect for even a daytime visit. Rooms do have a revamp but still somewhat dim. Food and drinks are on par with the benign price.

name: Molino Basin Campground
overview: Open from 1 Nov - 15 Apr. No hookups, trailers and RVs under 22' permitted. No water, vault toilets. There is a pleasant hike between this campground and Gordon Hirabayashi (see listing below); park all the way at the end of prison camp and walk downhill to Molino. The destruction from the Aspen fire is evident here as is all the new green growth.

name: Hilton Shanghai
overview: While still popular with business travelers for its recognizable name, the Hilton Shanghai has lost some of its luster, although its still considered a top end hotel in this area. Rooms are spacious and modern, and the staff are friendly, but the Hilton needs to step up its game.

name: Radisson BLU Gewandhaus
overview: The baroque 18th century Gewandhaus (''cloth hall'') was rebuilt in late 1960s as a hotel, and since 1997 has operated as a Radisson. The interior design, fixtures and furniture echo the building's history. Do note that there is also a different Radisson in [[Radebeul]] by Dresden, so make sure you do not confuse those two. | image=Dresden Gewandhaus 1.jpg

name: Royal Thalassa Monastir
overview: The only hotel with 5 stars in town.

name: Hotel Tradita
overview: As close as it gets to being invited to the dining hall, the kitchen and courtyard of the local Ottoman Pasha.

name: Chelsea Motor Inn
overview: Features an English Tudor style building with an antique roof. Clean, good quality rooms at a reasonable price. Nothing too special, but it is centrally located.

name: Hotel Sergul
overview: Affordable smart hotel with excellent links to West End and close to Olympia and Earls Court exhibition centre.

name: Gulf Hotel
overview: Pretty simple midrange hotel but very reasonable prices. Good executive rooms with air-con for a little extra charge.

name: Derzhava hotel
overview: Free Wi-Fi

name: Parus Business Center Hotel
overview: Possibly the best located hotel in town, though the noise from the river promenade is reported to sometimes get disturbing for those of the 82 rooms which are facing the Amur river. Unusually for Russia parts of the hotel are located in a classic pre-soviet brick building, and the rooms are spotless in the new wing. On-site Bar, Spa/Sauna, Restaurant and conference/meeting facilities.

name: Acclaim Hotel Calgary Airport
overview: 24 hour airport shuttle, rooftop jetted spas, restaurant, meeting & banquet facilities, wifi, fitness centre.

name: Nasa Vegas Hotel
overview: You can't miss this hotel walking down the road as the building is enormous. Rooms are a bit small and furniture a bit dated, but they are clean, so for the money paid it is a good value. Not really close to the airport, but it is close to the Ramkhamhaeng ARL stop, which takes you to the airport in about 20 minutes. The downside of the ARL is that it runs right beside the hotel, which makes some rooms noisy.

name: Hotel Pichlmayrgut
overview: The hotel is a traditional 4star hotel near Schladming. The spacious wellness alpine spa offers sauna areas and various pools.

name: Staybridge Suites
overview: All-suite hotel with full kitchens, free hot breakfast, indoor swimming pool, and complimentary wi-fi.

name: Heiwa no mori Park
overview: Very nice, big park. Lots of non-fenced woods, very easy to hide. There is quite a few people though, running around the track. There are also some homeless. There are rest huts, although they are likely to be occupied by homeless. There are public toilets. TIP : On the north side of the track, there are a few buildings. It is possible to go behind one of them and be VERY well hidden. It is not that well located (you need to take the train to get back into downtown Tokyo), but if you go to Nakano to see the shop where they sell things that people left on trains, it might be worth it, because you do not find these kinds of big parks in downtown Tokyo.

name: Armenia Marriott Hotel
overview: international standard hotel

name: Kalundborg Youth Hostel
overview: Part of the Danhostel chain. Large rooms with private bathroom, table and chairs. Shared faciliteis include Guest kitchen, laudry facilities, TV room, living room, billad, table tennis, piano, childrens' playground, outdoor chess and outdoor grill.

name: Dieci Hotel Milan
overview: The Dieci is a four star hotel of Milan located close to the Piola Metro stop, in the north-east part of the city. The 29 guest rooms are divided in single, double and triple, with en-suite services, satellite TV, internet connection and mini bar.

name: 26 on Aandbloem
overview: Views of Table Mountain and the Cape Town City Bowl.

name: Victoria Hotel
overview: A 1 star hotel that located in front of bus station and Am Bank. One of the earliest hotel in Labuan that still exist.

name: Tallink Spa & Conference Center
overview: Tallink's most upscale property is just what the label says, with a pool spa with a number of water-based amenities and a conference centre. The rooms are modern and decorated with sometimes bewilderingly clashing patterns, and some overlook the main pool atrium rather than the outside. There is a considerable distance from the hotel to everything else but the ferry terminal.

name: Columba Hotel
overview: As it is on the North Pier, rooms on three sides have sea views, some rooms at the back can be noisy from the pubs below.

name: Sigtuna Stadshotell
overview: Branded as Sweden's smallest 5-star hotel.

name: Santa Maria
overview: Nice hotel with friently service. Free use of bicycles for guests. Free WiFi

name: Hamanassett Bed & Breakfast
overview: Owned at one time by Abraham Lincoln's quartermaster general Montgomery Meigs.

name: Inmoba Apartments & Suites
overview: Serviced apartments on the top floors of this primarily residential tower block on the Alameda between Metro Baquedano and Metro Universidad Catolica. Excellent views over the city from the balcony and a daily cleaning service. The apartments have kitchens with microwave, oven and hob but no meals are provided, although there are many restaurants nearby to suit all budgets if you prefer not to cook for yourself. Internet access (ethernet cable provided, no Wi-Fi) is included in the price. There is a certain amount of noise inherent in the location, although no worse than in any other city centre. Good value for money and almost like having your own flat in the city.

name: Hótel Brú
overview: Hotel Bru offers eight rooms with private bathroom and eight rooms with a shared bathroom.  All the rooms are well equipped, on the upper floor are the eight rooms with shared bathrooms, on the ground floor are eight rooms with a private bathroom and each with a private entrance.

name: Sweet Dreams Guest House
address: House 126 Wat Bo St, Salakomrouek Commune
overview: Family-owned guesthouse. Clean, relaxed atmosphere with bar & restaurant. Free computer & free Wi-Fi. Friendly staff willing to help with ticket booking and trips to Angkor Wat.

name: Zikomo Safari Camp
overview: A small and personalized safari camp on a beautiful spot on the banks of the Luangwa river. This is the base for the South Luangwa Safaris that are conducted in open safari vehicles to give you that ‘bush’ touch feeling and the flexibility to make that unique picture to take home! The first time the Wallace family came to the Luangwa Valley in eastern Zambia were overwhelmed by the diverse and plentiful wildlife and the wildness of the Nsefu sector and the main South Luangwa National Park. The place or area is a trip back in time to old Africa where the people are friendly, and the wildlife is abundant. There is an old African saying which goes something like this; “once you get the dust of Africa on your boots, you will never be able to kick it off”. In other words; once you experience Africa, it will be in your heart forever. Wildlife is in danger all over the world, and especially in Africa. Photographic safari camps are one of the best ways to save wildlife as they; bring tourists in for the best safari explore, create jobs for locals, which makes both parties (the tourists and the locals) value their wildlife and habitat which helps save the animals for the whole world. The intention was to become part of larger conservation efforts taking place in the Luangwa valley and so we built Zikomo Safari Camp( the word Zikomo means thank you in a local dialect).

name: Lossujärvi open wilderness hut
overview: Open wilderness hut (6 persons). Wood fired stove.

name: Mumbul Guesthouse
overview: Located in the fishing village of Anturan and just a short walk to the beach. 4 rooms with hot water and air-con, all look out onto the adjacent rice field. Large pool and separate kids pool. Free WiFi, breakfast and taxes are included in the price.

name: Marina Motel
overview: Classic motor inn with a Mediterranean flavor — flower boxes fragrance the quaint European style rooms. They offer free wi-fi, free parking, and complimentary in room coffee.

name: The Lofts on Pearl
overview: The '''Webb Building''', also known as the '''Jewett M. Richmond Block''', was built in 1888 and is the finest example of Commercial Richardsonian Romanesque architecture remaining in Buffalo, but was vacant and falling apart in 2006, when local developer and preservationist Rocco Termini purchased the building and renovated it into a charming boutique hotel. Today, the Lofts on Pearl share with the adjacent '''Pearl Street Grill and Brewery''' not only an owner, but also an unequaled devotion to honoring Buffalo's history. This handsome property boasts 32 one- and two-bedroom suites with fireplaces, kitchens, full living rooms with sofa beds, and spacious closets, and can accommodate up to six guests each. Located in the heart of downtown in what has come to be called the "Brewery District", the Lofts on Pearl are convenient to shopping, dining, sports, and all other downtown and waterfront attractions.

name: Hotel Templeview
overview: Surrounded by the jungle, gives a true feeling of wilderness. Rooms are just about okay. Food is fine. Some parts of resort building are about 125 years old. The cottages have three large sized rooms and a large bathroom & dressing area  with respect to the price paid. The food and service are good. M54yost of all the location of the resort is the best value addition

name: Helnan Shepard's
overview: Views of the Nile from elegant rooms and enjoyable bars/restaurants.

name: Presidio Inn & Suites
overview: Small budget European style inn located in the Marina District.  They have free wi-fi and offer a complimentary breakfast.  It's just one block from Chestnut St.

name: MGM Grand
overview: Opened in 1993, this Hollywood themed resort has 5,044 guest rooms. 6.6 acres of swimming area, 2 wedding chapels, 3 theaters, multitudes of restaurants, a spa and salon, a 380,000 square foot conference center, shops galore, and 165,000 square feet of casino floor.

name: Challapampa
overview: Camp site in the valley next to the bridge. It has electric light during the evening, pipes with flowing water, a covered table with benches, a covered place for tents, but only a squat toilet. The little shop provides food and beer. Also cooked food can be bought by the family running the place.

name: Ruposhi Bangla Hotel
overview: This hotel has been running for over a decade now, and was, for the longest time, considered one of the top hotels in the city. Internet access in the room is expensive. Room service choice is fairly limited.

name: Sokos Hotel Vaakuna
overview: One of the more luxurious hotels in Joensuu, located next to the market square. The rooms seem to have been refurbished recently. There are three restaurants and a pub on the ground floor.

name: Hotel Dialog
overview: A no-frills hotel at IKEA.

name: Tha Khaek Travelers Lodge
address: 1 km south of the roundabout, from the market about 400 m further east
overview: A popular place in an undeveloped part of town, but with a friendly campfire garden layout. The inside rooms are very basic and the beds hard. It could do with some renovation but the outside seating just about makes up for this. It's a good place to meet people and arrange trips but easy to let it become the (pricy) source of all your meals as the centre of town with more options is about 2.5 km away. Stop by for some experienced reports on the Loop.

name: Kenraali Wasa Hostel
overview: Located in a former military compund made up of charming wooden barracks with roots in the 19th century. Within walking distance from the city center.

name: Trekkers Inn
overview: One popular lodge out of many in this village.

name: Hotel Grasia
overview: Three-star hotel in Gajahmungkur, Rates include buffet breakfast, pick-up service from/to airport,car wash, unlimited WiFi.

name: The Sebel
overview: Apartment hotel in the business and dining precinct at Viaduct Harbour.

name: Raisin
overview: This traditional inn still offers a handful of rooms, recently remodelled. The location is as central as it gets.

name: Hilton Strand
overview: Located across the Pitkäsilta bridge, a 15-minute walk or short tram ride away from the main railway station.

name: Aston Ilander Resort
overview: This hotel provides condominium living. Two-story resort is set in six acres of gardens, with a pool and a beachfront location. All rooms have a private balcony. Beachfront swimming pool, jet spa, WiFi. Tennis courts and golf courses nearby.

name: Cwtch Cottages
overview: Self catering cottages close to Saint Davids Square. Sleeps up to 5 (double room, twin room and room with bunk beds). Private garden with BBQ facilities, Wi-Fi, wood burner and full central heating.

name: Landmark Inn
overview: An inn located in a former church building.

name: Hotel Nansui
overview: Located near many of the Sakamoto Ryoma sites, the hotel itself contains a life-size replica of one of Sakamoto Ryoma's robes in the lobby.

name: The Carlyle
overview: A luxury boutique hotel, the Carlyle offers rooms and suites for extended stays, and luxury apartments and rentals.

name: Hotelli Kuninkaantie
overview: The only hotel in Espoon Keskus.

name: Favehotel Pasar Baru Jakarta
overview: Budget style boutique hotel. Standard room (the suite only has a sofa next to it). Breakfast options are slightly less than plenty but satisfactory.

name: Bed and Breakfast Luna Luna
overview: Jef Denynplein 4-6. A very spacious suite, situated along a city canal, in the historical heart of the city.

name: HI-Îles-de-la-Madeleine
overview: This hostel is open May 17 to September 30. Open year-round for groups.

name: Holiday Inn
overview: Well furnished rooms. Reasonable breakfast, good service. A little way out of the centre of town.

name: El Viajero Hostel
overview: Well-run, clean, friendly hostel just a few metres from the historic old city. WiFi, computers, kitchen, great common area. Live music on the weekends.

name: Kingman KOA
overview: Sites for tents and RVs with hookups as well as cabin rentals. Pool, wi-fi, and showers.

name: Hoshinoya Taketomi
overview: By far the fanciest digs in Taketomi, and quite possibly in all Okinawa, Hoshinoya is a luxury ryokan cunningly disguised as an Okinawan village, with open-air pavilions and low coral walls, plus the standard hotel amenities of pool, spa, etc.  The restaurant serves Okinawan-influenced French ''nouvelle cuisine'' and even the plates are custom-made, which explains why dinner costs ¥12,000/person, although at lunch you can get away with ¥1000 for a bowl of noodles.  Located near Aiyuruhama Beach, but quite a hike away from the village.

name: Anyavee Railay
overview: Three room types, swimming pool, daily breakfast.

name: Seven Brothers
overview: At the heart of the port, to the centre of the town, in a quiet place, opposite the Iroon statue, and next to Alpha bank. Magnificent view of the port with the boats, the beach of Galatas opposite.

name: Richmond Place Inn
overview: In a quiet residential neighborhood near where the Elmwood Village, Allentown, and the Lower West Side converge, the Richmond Place Inn is a lovely bed and breakfast in a distinctive old house. In addition to on-site parking, laundry facilities, and a delectable breakfast available in the dining room or delivered directly to the guest rooms, the Richmond Place Inn's units boast air conditioning, cable TV with HBO, and (in some cases) private baths.

name: Mercure Paris Centre Tour Eiffel
overview: A relatively large mid-range hotel very close to the Eiffel Tower, in a nice, quiet and green area of Grenelle. Despite the closeness, only about a quarter of the rooms, designated as such and commanding higher rates, feature a view of the tower itself. All of the rooms and common spaces have been renovated and feature modern decor inspired by the tower and the metro. The rooms are very functional and feature operable windows, but the amounts of plastic and the violet theme may not provide for a romantic Parisian experience.

name: Pakalana Inn
overview: 5 nice, newly restored rooms in the second floor of an old building in downtown Hilo. Free Wi-Fi, ocean or mountain views, key-less doors, very short walking distance to all the downtown Hilo offerings. Be there Wednesday or Saturday mornings for the Hilo Farmer's Market action.

name: Torcroft Hotel
overview: Torcroft Hotel is a stylish and friendly B&B. They have 11 rooms including 2 large balcony rooms, 2 deluxe double rooms, a family room and twins and doubles. All rooms are en-suite and have flat screen TVs. Free parking and Wi-Fi. Great breakfasts.

name: Mövenpick Hotel
overview: The hotel is located in the Eastern Docklands, the renewed area of the city centre which makes it perfect for business or pleasure.

name: Duquesne House Bed & Breakfast
overview: A historic adobe inn built in 1898 on Patagonia's original main street.

name: Nayoro Onsen Sunpillar
overview: Beside Piyashiri Ski Area. The bath is a hot spring.

name: The Londonears Hostel
overview: Youth hostel for those willing to sleep in a bunk bed in a dormitory with many others.

name: Novotel Lombok
address: Pantai Putri Nyale, Lombok Seletan (''South Lombok'')
overview: 4 star Novotel resort on the picturesque white sandy beach of Kuta. Built in the style of a traditional Sasak village. Renovated in 2011 with 77 superior and deluxe rooms and 23 'Sasak' villas, each with a private garden and terrace. Two beachfront restaurants, a fitness centre, 2 spas, 4 swimming pools located in the hotel gardens and beachside, a natural lagoon, water sports, ''Kids Club'', daily activities, health programs and meeting rooms for up to 120 people. All rooms are equipped with individually controlled A/C, WiFi, IDD telephone, satTV. Located near popular surfing areas with horse riding and Dive Zone-Novotel available at the resort. Fairly remote location, but taxis are available. This is the best hotel on the south coast. Expect Western prices for lunch, dinner and drinks.

name: Dolder Grand
overview: Kurhausstrasse 65, Recently renovated flagship hotel of Zurich with amazing view and excellent spa.

name: Scandic Norra Bantorget
overview: A large, mid-range hotel in the northern section of central Stockholm. Approximately 1 km from Central Station, 500 m from Hötorget metro station on the Green Line.

name: andel's Hotel Łódź
overview: A very original hotel in an adapted historical textile manufacture next to Poznański Palace. It won the "Architecture of the Year" in 2009 in the European Hotel Design Award competition.

name: Comfort Inn Gaslamp Convention Center
overview: A 100% non-smoking hotel located in the Gaslamp Quarter.

name: Seaview Hotel
overview: A 1950's art deco gem one block from the ocean.  The rooms are upgraded with fresh colors, cozy fibers and trendy furniture.  Each room includes free wireless, flat screen TV's and free maid service.

name: Jay's Nyali Homestay
overview: Four guest rooms; one single and three doubles. Rooms have cable tv and Wi-Fi. They offer free airport transfer and you can rent bikes and tents there.

name: Mini-hotel Krupskiy
overview: Located in the very center of the city

name: Hotel Nissa
overview: Atabaeva Street, 18B,  Apparently owned by family of Saparmurat Niyazov, this is a four-star hotel with air conditioning, swimming pool, pool bar, sauna, Turkish sauna, gym, jacuzzi. This is about the "best" quality hotel you'll find in Ashgabat (think somewhat run-down and a bit overpriced for its features), about a 10 minute walk from the war memorial and book shop. The restaurant has decent Italian food. Expect to come across lots of foreign workers, and women of dubious persuasion at the hotel bar. Some English is, however, spoken.

name: Flying Kiwi Backpackers
overview: 20 beds

name: StayAt Bromma
overview: A business hotel.

name: Taft Bridge Inn
overview: 100 year old mansion located in quiet neighborhood. Rooms include breakfast each morning. Private baths and shared baths available.

name: Araz Hotel
overview: About a kilometre from the ferry port.

name: Marlen Hotel
overview: Wi-Fi. 10 room / 21 bed.

name: Wangfujing Dawan Hotel
address: 2 Ganyu Hutong, Dongdan Bei Street (东单北大街甘雨胡同甲2号; Dōngdānběidàjiēgānyǔhútòng)
overview: Rooms with free Internet, television, a/c and fridge. Business center and bath center including sauna available. Chinese restaurant. The rooms are alright, the bathrooms not too bright or clean, and the service level fluctuates, but the low price and great location make up for it.

name: House of Kititto
overview: Mixture between ordinary guesthouse and homestay, 9 assorted rooms available. Operated by young couple, Kent/Monica, who love travel and happy to share travel tips with their guests. Free wifi.

name: Guest House Inn
overview: This hotel is situated in the center of Old Town in a calm area, 10 minutes on foot to the nearest metro station, very friendly staff.

name: Hotel Vertigo
overview: A hotel with lots of bright colors and relatively few amenities compared to other splurge hotels in the area, but with nice rooms and a friendly staff.

name: Cwmshon Cottages
address: Old Road, Ynysmeudwy, Pontardawe, Swansea SA8 4PL
overview: 5 star Visit Wales cottages - each sleeps 6 - in quiet village location close to shops and amenities. Convenient for Gower, Mumbles, Brecon Beacons, Black Mountain. Dedicated bike storage and bike washing facilities - 20 mins to Afan Forest Mountain Bike Centre. Awards : Tripadvisor Certificate of Excellence 2014, Tourism Swansea Bay 2012 "Best Self Catering Accommodation".

name: Rainforest Bed & Breakfast
overview: Boutique budget hotel with dorm bed and private rooms. Beautiful building with tasteful, rainforest-themed decorations. Clean and air-conditioned dorms and rooms with key card entry and Wi-Fi available. Several common rooms are available with televisions and small, covered porches with couches on the upper floors.

name: Courtyard Stockholm Kungsholmen
overview: The only Marriott hotel in Stockholm. Rooms with internet, aircon, coffee maker, ironing board, fridge and safe. The hotel has a fitness centre and a restaurant with local and international cuisine. Expensive parking at 295 SEK.

name: Lalbagh Youth Hostel
overview: 50 seats in dormitory. Booking: Directoraate of Youth Services, Government of West Bengal, 32/1 BBD Bagh South, Standard Building, 2nd Floor, Kolkata - 700001, Telelphones: 91- 033 22480626, 22109206, 22106767

name: Plaza Hotel
overview: Actually three hotels all run by the same company - The Plaza, The Rex and The Acropolis. All similar standard and nearby to each other.

name: Astoria Hotel
overview: Clean, large, albeit drab, rooms with private bathrooms.

name: Taos Inn
overview: Features a 1950s-style neon sign out front; this is a very comfortable and nicely renovated hotel right in the middle of the tourist attractions, a great base camp for exploring the town. The restaurant (Doc Martin's) and bar (Adobe Bar) are popular with visitors and locals alike.

name: Days Inn
overview: Outdoor pool, free breakfast, free wireless internet available. No pets.

name: Lime Tree Lodge
overview: Great service.

name: Windemere Hotel & Conference Center
overview: Swimming pool, pets permitted. Includes one free happy hour drink at the onsite bar, as well as continental breakfast. Free wi-fi. While earlier online reviews of this hotel have in general been positive, reviews from 2014 are for the most part negative describing the hotel as run-down and filthy.

name: ANA Hotel Tokyo
address: Located between the Tameike-Sanno subway station and the Roppongi Ichome station
overview: An international hotel and all staff can speak English. The rooms are a decent size compared to most American hotels. There is also a limousine bus connecting the ANA Hotel to Narita Airport - it takes approximately two hours and is available to both guests of the hotel and people with other accommodations.

name: Hotel Voskhod
overview: Relatively cheap and modest accommodation in the outskirts of the city.

name: Tulip Inn
overview: 64 rooms all with balcony. Renovated in Aug 2007. There are two restaurants and a bar.

name: Elmina Bay
overview: A brand new quality hotel.  All rooms have sea view and own balcony and are comfortably furnished. Good food, efficient staff. Lovely pool.  Good for walking along the beach and just chilling out. Highly recommended.

name: Lamplighter Lodge
overview: Just minutes from downtown Red Bluff and I-5, the Lamplighter Lodge, a Magnuson Hotels affiliate, is convenient to William B. Adobe State Historic Park, Redding, Shasta Lake, Red Bluff Round Up, Rolling Hills Casino, Sacramento River Discovery Center, shopping, museums, and many restaurants to choose from. Guests will enjoy comfortable rooms with free wireless internet and an outdoor pool to relax in.

name: The Lombok Lodge
overview: Boutique beachside hotel opened in 2010 with 7 lodge-suites overlooking the north western coastline of Lombok. Quiet and secluded position, distinctive contemporary and stylish design, infinity pool overlooks the beach and sea . Suites equipped with A/C, 32” flat screen satellite TV, DVD player, Bose Sounddeck, itouch, electronic personal safe and wifi internet access. See promotions section on their website.

name: Hotel Ali
overview: Rue Moulay Ismail. Beds in ensuite, dorms, and rooftop terrace mattresses for Dh 60 per person per night, including cooked breakfasts served with OJ and fresh coffee. Dorm guests can use the internet cafe for Dh 5 per hour. They have all the amenities a backpacker could ask for, including a laundry service and free internet access for private room guests, money exchange, a terrace restaurant with views of Djemaa El-Fna, and even a downstairs ''hammam''. Private rooms are available with a maximum per person price of Dh 250 per night including breakfast, free internet, and a daily traditional Hammam.

name: Amari Emerald Cove Koh Chang
overview: This tropical getaway offers a dive centre, a 50 m lap pool and 5 dining options.

name: Sunrise Inn
overview: Locally owned and established. Built on rocks, sitting over the lake, facing Mozambique. Stunning views and incredible opportunities for birdwatching, snorkelling, boating and riding in local dugout canoes. Experience the island in a calm and relaxed environment.

name: Hyatt Regency
overview: Centrally located hotel with a sports bar and hosts Jazz concerts on Fridays during the summer. The hotel is circular shaped, which, depending on your luck may give you a view of a parking lot, another hotel, or Carew Tower and the Fifth Third Building.

name: Radisson Blu Hotel Birmingham
overview: The Radisson is located in a blue glass tower, with views over Birmingham's city centre, and is one of the few truly modern high-end hotels in the city.

name: Grand Hyatt Beijing
address: 1 East Chang'an Avenue (东长安街1号, Dōngcháng'ānjiē
overview: Privately-owned, exquisite, and expensive five-star hotel. There is an enormous swimming pool in the basement that is decorated in very tropical manner, but the deepest part is only 1.5m (5ft). The jacuzzi and wet sauna are excellent. Great hotel and great location, if you can afford it.

name: Waikawa B&B and Snapper Bach
overview: Waterfront accommodation. Private upstairs bed & breakfast en suite (queen bed, kitchenette, balcony), or for those wishing to stay slightly longer a modern two bedroom (queen bed/2 singles) fully self-contained bach - apart from food, everything supplied including quality bedding, linen, towels, dining, cookware etc. Secluded setting with superb sea views to active volcano White Island. Private access to rocky bay - excellent diving, fishing, kayaking etc.

name: Unity hostel
overview: Free breakfast, tiny rooftop terrace. Cramped but clean, central, cheerful, safe and cheap. Lockers and kitchen. 24 hr open. It has sister hostel on Lake Balaton.

name: Traders Inn
overview: Coffee Lounge offers various Asian and western cuisine as well as coffee and treats. Free Wi-Fi is available in every room. Make sure to book at appointment at the Foot Reflexology Center after a long day of sightseeing.

name: Hostel Bellavista
overview: Hostel located in a great area for dining out and nightlife but can be loud on the weekends. The staff is friendly with some glaring exceptions. There are several computers and free Wi-Fi, a large common room equipped with a TV, DVD player, plenty of seating, pool table and a guitar. Very popular with young international backpackers and independent travelers.

name: Hotel Ibis
overview: In one location, the Ibis offers quality Accor Hotels

name: Helsingør Camping
overview: Directly on the beach north of the castle, there is no faulting the location of this campsite. If you didn't bring a tent they have basic cabins sleeping up to 6 people, during high season and summer weekends you are required to stay at least 2–3 days in the cabins.

name: Hay Farm House
overview: 3 room guesthouse

name: Alpha Hotel
address: St. D.Galitskogo (former Vul. Universytetska), вул. Д.Галицького (бувша Університетськавул., ), 78

name: Amstel House Berlin
overview: A newly refurbished guest house in an Art Nouveau style building.

name: Stratton Gardens
overview: Recently refurbished 16th-century guest house and gardens. Five rooms, all en-suite, free Wi-Fi, breakfast included, served daily 8:30AM-9:30AM. Lounge with licensed bar, hosts Liz & Jan.

name: Radisson SAS Falconer Hotel
overview: Hotel and conference centre in one of the rare tall buildings of Copenhagen. If you get the right rooms on the upper floors, views can be amazing. It is starting to show its age though, so rooms and hallways can seem a bit worn out though this is no major issue. Facilities are good and includes a commercial gym with free access for guests and a business centre.

name: Pacific Tradewinds Backpackers
overview: The highest rated and smallest hostel in San Francisco. On the edge of Chinatown and the Financial District. Friendly, clean, modern and safe. Free internet.

name: Riga City Camping
overview: Open May 15 - September 15. Nice facilities.

name: Rancho Valencia Resort
overview: Luxury resort, featuring a spa, tennis and golf, with 49 suites.

name: Comwell Borupgaard
overview: Hotel at a former manor house with spa bath and pool at the roof terrace. Rooms with free internet and minibar. Billiard, volleyball, golf and other outdoor facilities available.

name: Hotel Aranyhomok
overview: **** is directly overlooking the main square of Kecskemét.

name: 500 West Hotel
overview: YMCA-affiliated Hostel in downtown San Diego, right next to Amtrak railway station. Free Wi-Fi.

name: Miss Sophie's
overview: This designer boutique hotel/hostel is the perfect destination for a quiet getaway in the heart of Prague's New Town. Miss Sophie's offers private hotel rooms, apartments, and shared rooms. Gourmet breakfast is prepared and served daily in brick cellar basement.

name: Four Points by Sheraton Barcelona Diagonal
overview: The Four Points offers simply furnished yet sunny rooms thanks to their floor-to-ceiling windows, straight on the Diagonal. Despite most Four Points hotels having deteriorated badly as the brand got neglected by Starwood in favour of Aloft, this hotel still maintains its original standard.

name: Hyatt Regency Minneapolis
overview: Rooms start at $189 per night, but discounts can be had. The Hyatt is also home to two high quality dining experiences: Oceanaire and Taxxi.

name: Sam's Guesthouse
overview: All rooms come with air-con, most are wooden bungalows in a quiet area on the River Kwai.

name: Hotel Ibis
overview: a more impersonal European chain hotel, but very clean and peaceful. It is within a short taxi ride of all the action. If you want to be able to escape the hustle and bustle during the heat of the day and chill out by a pool, this place is perfect. Decent value for the money as well, with lovely rooms and showers. Free internet with wifi is provided in the lobby.

name: The Blue House
overview: Blue House is located on a one way street named after the 19th century painter “Lamorinière François”. You will find information about this painter in the cosy nook on the first floor of the Blue House. The Blue House is very well located. It is close to both the Central Station and the Berchem Station. Being close to the stations means that buses and trams are easily available with the bus and tram stops a close walking distance from the Blue House. Blue House lies in a typical Jewish neighbourhood. A unique experience. Your stay is possible on the first or the second floor of the house.

name: Arsenic & Old Lace Bed and Breakfast Inn
overview: We are 2 blocks from the Eureka Springs Historic Loop, shops, restaurants, and galleries. Private, off-street parking is provided.

name: Kukkolaforsen Turist & Konferens
overview: Situated 15 km north of Haparanda next to beautiful rapids. Cottages, different types of saunas and a restaurant. Also places for tents, campers and caravans.

name: Roganstown Hotel and Country Club
overview: This four-star Hotel and Country Club is a destination for relaxation, fine food and exceptional golf, set among 120 hectares of peaceful lakes and rolling hills. Each one of the luxuriously appointed bedrooms is cleverly designed to offer spectacular views over our championship golf course, Japanese style courtyard or mature front gardens. All guestrooms include complimentary high speed internet access, mini bar, laptop safe, iron and ironing board, hairdryer, TV and tea/coffee making facilities. Facilities include restaurant, bar, full leisure centre, indoor swimming pool, 18 hole golf course, wedding and conference venues and ample free car parking. Not served by public transport but shuttle bus available on request to Swords or Dublin Airport for €5.

name: Shade Guest House
overview: Grungy, dilapidated, single storey courtyard reminiscent of a tiny stableyard just opposite the Matatu (minibus) station so noisy and dusty. Rooms are small, depressing and fly-blown with shared ablutions that are not quite as bad as the general ambience might lead you to expect. No security whatever, but Entebbe is a relatively honest place so this might not worry you as much as if it were in Kampala. Perhaps the most unusual feature is their pricing structure: a room for two people with twin (2) beds costs UGX25,000 while one double bed costs 2,000 shillings more at UGX27,000. The more hygienically sensitive may prefer to camp in one of the more leafy suburban establishments for a few thousand shillings less.

name: DeSoto Beach Hotel
overview: Tybee Island’s ONLY Beachfront Hotel! The DeSoto Beach Hotel is located less than 20 minutes from Historic Downtown Savannah, 45 minutes from the Savannah/Hilton Head International Airport, and only steps from Tybee Island’s beautiful beachfront.

name: Castle Hotel
overview: 18 room hotel in a house built in 18th century.

name: SunPark Resorts
overview: 3 star property with facilities such as discotheque, coffee shop.

name: Montrose Bed & Breakfast
overview: Home stay.

name: Central Duangtawan Hotel
overview: Excellent luxury hotel with cheap(er) Internet rates. Popular with tour groups and conventioneers. The Internet here is slow and not included in the room rate. Probably a little cheaper than similar hotels as it's near the beer bar district, but the area is quite safe and the hotel is high quality. For those not staying at the hotel, for 300 baht per day, you can use the excellent gym on the fourth floor (includes a gender-segregated Jacuzzi, steam room, and sauna, as well as a large L-shaped swimming pool that looks out on downtown Chiang Mai).

name: KING's Hotel First Class
overview: 4 Star Hotel, very individual, no hotel chain, four poster bed and internet access in every room, friendly service, dogs allowed.

name: Chelsea Hotel
address: Hanoi Road, corner of Mody Road
overview: Quite a bit nicer than the budget places, not a lot more expensive, prime location.

name: Cristal Grand Ishtar Hotel
overview: A hotel in central Baghdad.

name: Hotel Metropol
overview: Don't expect much of a view, unless you consider an intersection and the Novotel a view.

name: Hotel Cindrella
overview: A four star hotel on Sevoke Road.

name: Hotel Perla
address: Rruga "Deshmoret e Pojskes" and Rruga Vllazerimi cnr., Lagja1,
overview: recently renovated, three star, Tel. +355 83226688, facilities Bar, Restaurant, Credit card accepted, Air conditioned, Garden, Room service - 24 hour, Suitable for children, Laundry service, Multilingual staff, Tourist information, Housekeeping, TV, Meeting room, Front desk - 24 hour, Banqueting service, Private bathroom, Parking. 20 rooms of which 5 twins, 8 doubles, 3 triples and 4 suites

name: 2A-Hostel
overview: Cheap modern hostel, buildt up 2011. Located next to S Neukölln.

name: Cascade Country Manor
overview: Luxury Family Accommodation in the Olive Valley of the Cape winelands. Nine luxurious double rooms with views of the Waterfall and surrounding Orchards and Vineyards. Dinners showcase fresh local produce.

name: Columbia Hotel
overview: Hostel accommodations in an old historical building in the middle of Gastown.

name: Sant Jordi Hostel Gracia
overview: The hostel has mixed dorms for 4 to 8 people. It is open 24 hours on the day. Fully equipped kitchen.

name: Courtyard at Grand Wayne Convention Center
overview: This brand new downtown hotel is a prime option in the newly designed Harrison Square

name: Residenz Hotel Pension
overview: Three star hotel, pets permitted, free wi-fi, non-smoking.

name: Chelsea House Hotel
overview: The staff is very gentle and helpful. It is clean, and the rooms are all right, they are a bit small, have fridge, a small TV, but no table. The hotel is not nice, but OK. The breakfast is uninteresting, except the coffee, which is awful! But, the tea and the juice are good. It is close to many pubs, cafés and shops. Good place to stay, but lots of traffic.

name: Radisson Blu
overview: 4-Star hotel next to the Botanical Gardens by Dammtor station, the upper floors have stunning views of the city and gardens. Connected to Conference Center Hamburg (CCH)

name: Iberville Suites
overview: Caters to business, leisure, family, and is also gay/lesbian friendly. Spacious suites with huge bed, kitchen, large bathroom, living room with fold out, and 2 TVs. Valet parking, free bell-hop, lots of amenities, and free breakfast. They also feature fantastic massages at their spa.

name: Omena Hotel Tampere II
overview: The local branch of a budget hotel chain, centrally located on the main street. A self-service hotel (no reception desk).

name: Hotel Meson de los Poetas
overview: The hotel is a restored 18th-century house and centrally located, with helpful English-speaking staff.

name: Eiffel Tower Hostel
overview: Really awesome place run by a Welshman an American and a Georgian girl. This place is fun and relaxing and is in a great location. If your adventurous sleep on the top level of the 3 story bunkbeds. .

name: Sokos Hotel Villa
overview: Built into an old grain storehouse, located right behind the railway station in the city centre.

name: Fiesta Americana Grand Chapultepec
overview: The location of the Fiesta American Grand Chapultepec is perfect, being close to the restaurants of Polanco and Condesa. Rooms are clean, quiet and very comfortable.

name: Nairn Falls Provincial Campground
overview: Seasonal, bookings for busy summer weekends are best made months in advance.

name: Hostel Polestar
overview: One of few accommodation options for tourists wishing to stay in Antarctica. Basic hostel with room for 20 people.

name: Holitel
overview: Standard rooms with air-con and a private bathroom, rooms are really clean. Friendly and helpful staff.

name: Holiday Inn Paris Elysees
overview: Contemporary 4-star hotel near Champs Elysees and rue Faubourg Saint-Honoré.

name: White Wolf
overview: Located along the Tioga Pass Road, White Wolf is open from July through September and offers 24 tent cabins and 4 cabins with private bath.  The tent cabins are wood frame on a raised wooden platform and include beds, linen, and a wood stove.

name: Etap Berlin Ost
overview: typical low budget hotel managed by the Accor group.

name: N.Home Stay
overview: A family owned, operated guest house in a peaceful and quite colony away from the city traffic and pollution. Free parking, 24hr free Wi-Fi, cable TV, all day water supply and accessible roof top.

name: Area D Hostel
overview: Just opened recently (end 2013) to provide affordable accommodation for budget travellers.

name: Elephant Hide of Knysna Accommodation
overview: On top of the Welbedacht Cliff Tops 3 km from Knysna Town, the Lodge overlooks the Knysna Lagoon and the Outeniqua mountains. The theme of the Lodge is one based on natural beauty with stone and wood architecture combining to give that comfortable earth feel. The surroundings attracting numerous bird species. All the suites have double showers with views and are private. The lodge is a family run business that prides itself on personal service.

name: Radisson Blu Hotel Latvija
overview: Defining landmark on Riga's skyline and the largest business and conference hotel in the Baltics.

name: Nairi Hotel
overview: Located outside the city center this hotel offers a relaxing atmosphere

name: Hotel Algirdas
overview: New Scandinavian style hotel in the centre.

name: Super 8
overview: Free wi-fi and breakfast, pet-friendly.

name: Barksdale House Inn
overview: A quiet, low-key bed and breakfast wonderfully close to the College of Charleston and the King Street shopping district, but still offers privacy and comfort. Call for last-minute rates and you may get a substantial discount, but don't count on that during busy times.

name: Hotel Vanha Rauma
overview: A hotel right in the heart of Old Rauma. Includes a restaurant. Earlier known as Hotel Kalatori and Kalatorin Majatalo.

name: Crowne Plaza Duqm
overview: Has pool, tennis courts, gym. Onsite restaurant, free Wi-Fi.

name: Hôtel Astor Saint Honoré
overview: 4-star hotel on a quiet street.

name: Hotel Club Ramon
overview: A decent place to stay at moderate prices. Five floors of rooms.

name: Coco del mer
