overview: A Chinese guesthouse which doubles as both a Youth Hostel and a Brothel, with very little guests being travellers (July 2011 - most people seems to be travellers, not a bad option to the other expensive YHA's). Relatively cheap, but the rooms are small. WiFi in some rooms and fans available. Laundry ¥10 per load. The owners/managers speak no English, but can understand sign language - if you call, you may want to have a Mandarin speaker to make a booking.

name: Assaroe Falls
overview: Donegal. With breath taking views of the River Erne and Donegal Bay, the apartments are exquisitely designed, are decorated and furnished to an extremely high standard.

name: Sedona Real Inn & Suites
overview: A pleasant hotel on the outskirts of town, just off 89A. Rooms have exterior entrances; they're a bit on the small side but they're clean and well-decorated. Free hot breakfast with some very good options, and free wi-fi. Concierge and pool; pet-friendly.

name: Hali'i Kai at Waikoloa Beach
overview: Hali’i Kai, is the only ocean front resort complex on the Kohala Coast. Located within the Waikoloa Beach Resort, Hali’i Kai provides easy access to a variety of island adventures: whale watching, helicopter rides, volcano tours, deep sea fishing, scuba diving and world-famous golf.

name: Backpackers Miyajima
overview: A hostel in Miyajima-guchi, which is on the mainland (close to the ferry terminal). The English-speaking staff hold BBQ, camping dinner parties. Free wifi, shared bathrooms, kitchen, and paid laundry is available.

name: Hotel Capanelle
overview: Convenient for the Appian Way park and if you want to go to the races at Capannelle horse track. Short walk from Parco degli Aquedotti and Villa dei Quintili. Easily reached if you are coming from the south by car. Well-rated hotel but you will have to rely on an infrequent shuttle or public transport if you want to use it as a base for exploring downtown Rome.

name: Nevsky Express Hotel
overview: 3 star hotel near the central station and the Ploschad Vosstania underground station.

name: Tourist Guesthouse
overview: A popular backpackers choice near the railway station. A very nice place with a decent restaurant and friendly owners. About 25 minutes walking distance to the Golden Temple.

name: Hotel Iris
overview: Upscale hotel in central Honjo.  There is a restaurant.

name: Aigua Alghero B&B and Rent a Car
overview: Typical architecture Latin

name: Hotel Hanstholm
overview: swimmingpool, sauna, fitness facilities and a restaurant.

name: Hotel Villa Fontaine Kobe Sannomiya
overview: A stylish boutique hotel squeezed into the immediate neighbourhood of Sannomiya station. All rates include a complimentary breakfast.

name: Baku Station Hotel
overview: Under renovation as of Oct 2009.

name: Country Inn & Suites By Carlson
overview: Has complimentary breakfast and wi-fi, pets accepted. Offers free shuttle service to/from the airport (M-F 8AM-5PM, by prior arrangement).

name: Golubaya Laguna
overview: A small hotel a bit far from the sea. Works from May to October.

name: Hotel Le Flamboyant
overview: Well managed hotel, quiet, with a small swimming pool. Opposite to the consulates of France and Guinea-Bissau. The restaurant of this hotel is on the other side of the street, in a building which hosts a ''Hotel tourist'' which has rooms where basically everything is broken for CFA 13.000.

name: Smuggler's Inn Bed & Breakfast
overview: Eight guest rooms in a three-story Victorian house.

name: Druzhba Hotel
overview: Imposing pyramid structure on the inlet.

name: Hotel Velotrek
address: slightly hidden behind the Respublica Velotrek bicycle race course through a tall iron gate on the left hand side. 20 January Metro Station
overview: A few kilometers north of the centre, this budget hotel has clean rooms with TV, private bath and hot water in the mornings.

name: Tulip Inn Media Park Hilversum
overview: The Tulip Inn is between the town centre and the Media Park and can be used as a place to stay for both areas. It is in the same neighbourhood as the Town Hall. Wi-Fi is accessible free of charge throughout the building and there's a sauna, fitness room, conference rooms, restaurant and bar. Bicycles can be hired upon request.

name: Old Dutch
overview: Hotel Old Dutch is located opposite the railway station in a historic building.

name: Best Hotel Garni
overview: Very basic facilities, no window or extractor fan in toilet, no TV despite being advertised. Some "double rooms" consist of two single beds fixed about 4 metres apart from each other. Wi-Fi is a chargeable extra, and they demand full payment before issuing your key. Its best selling point may be its location.

name: Ukulhas Inn
overview: All rooms are ''en suite'' with hot and cold water, individually controlled air-con. King sized bed, LCD TV with satellite channels, CD/DVD player, free Wi-Fi, mini-bar, hair dryer, phone, touch light and umbrella.

name: The Mushroom Farm
overview: Super cute, eco GLAMping within walking distance of Livingstonia. Mushroom Farm offers different types of rental options including cabins, safari tents, shared dorms, and camping. Food and bar serving primarily vegan and vegetarian food is onsite.

name: Boston Art Hotel
overview: Exclusive 4 star design hotel in Turin historical center, near train station.

name: Hôtel L’Oiselière Montmagny
overview: Pool, spa, meeting facilities, restaurant with seafood, high table, Sunday brunch.

name: easyHotel Budapest Oktogon
overview: Cheap hotel, with small rooms.

name: STF Gärdet
overview: A hostel just at the grassy field at Gärdet, with a beach-volleyball court.

name: Treviris camper parking
overview: Big parking area. Showers, toilet. No power.

name: Plaza Hotel
overview: Of all the historic buildings in town, the Plaza Hotel is the crown jewel of them all. It was lovingly restored in 1982, and has become Las Vegas' premiere place to stay, and is a very popular locale for meetings, parties, conventions and other events. Enjoy the Victorian atmosphere with elegant antiques and exquisite architecture. The amenities offered include the Landmark Grill, an in-house restaurant, the old west Byron T's Saloon, spa massage treatment, guest computer and wireless high-speed internet access, pet friendly rooms, room service, and free parking.

name: Hotel Blue Horizon
overview: Friendly staff, and good room service breakfasts.

name: Elverdams Camping
overview: Situated in the middle of Røsnæs Peninsula and an ideal base for exploring Røsnæs, 300m away from the coast. Beautifully situated and landscaped site. Kitchen, toilet, bath, fireplace, playground and playing field available.

name: Omenahotelli
overview: Number of rooms: 57

name: Hotel Tahran
overview: Hotel Tahran is inexpensive and very basic hotel with surprisingly clean but small bathrooms. They also provide depository service for unnecessary stuff when doing a trip across the border to Iran or up to Ararat. Manager speaks very good English and is very helpful about all things local. Laundry service is 3 TL per kilo and very quick (can give laundry in the late evening and get it back semi-dry in the morning). Good breakfast with some view. Occasional problems with Internet.

name: The Palace Hotel
overview: Established in 1875, The Palace has 552 guest rooms. In 1945, the official banquet honoring the opening session of the United Nations was held in The Garden Court at The Palace.

name: Hotel Klöpp
overview: In a side street close to Laugavegur. Very close to a number of bars and clubs, but surprisingly quiet apart from one bar across the street which often has live jazz or folk music on weekends. Part of the CenterHotels chain like Hotel Plaza below.

name: Neverland
overview: Basic hotel that has internet, kitchen, common rooms, breakfast and tea; Pets are welcome; Organised by a very friendly collective.

name: Matkustajakoti Rauhala
overview: Basic accommodation in a guesthouse near the railway station in the village Myllykoski.

name: Jaldapara Tourist Lodge
overview: It much bigger than Hollong Tourist Lodge and has dormitories too. Direct booking at Tourist Lodge.

name: Southern Sun
overview: Part of the Tsogo Sun hotel chain. Botanical gardens located on site. En-suite rooms that are large and have mini-bars, safes, coffee makers, and free wifi. There are also two restaurants onsite. A bit far from city centre but still fine to walk during the day.

name: The Venetian
overview: A high-end hotel located near the center of the Strip and offering everything from the Grand Canal shops to shows and connected to The Palazzo complex. Rooms are spacious with quality furnishings although no coffee/tea making facilities and it can be a long walk from your room to facilities. Plumbing occasionally questionable (noise and temperature).

name: Arlington Hotel and Pub
overview: Hostel in century-old building. Hiking, mountain biking and canoeing trips to Algonquin Park for $40 per person per day. Free wi-fi.

name: Hotel Landgoed Groot Warnsborn
overview: Elegant country-park hotel on the outskirts of Arnhem surrounded by 750 hectares of woodland.

name: Hotel Acapulco
overview: Can Sleep (if possible with all the noise from Ave Coahuila), Play cards with the desk clerk ($10 a hand) or chat (or other things) with Carla from Acalpulco all night.

name: Mövenpick Resort & Petra
overview: Located directly at the entrance to the historic city of Petra, the luxurious Mövenpick Resort Petra is certainly one of the most notable hotels in the Middle East. The Mövenpick Resort Petra is delighted to welcome its guests and visitors to the newly refurbished and tastefully decorated rooms and suites. The newly remodeled rooms and suites are elegantly designed and decorated with modern stylish furniture and fixtures that will satisfy the most discerning individual. All rooms and suites are equipped with the latest technological requirements such as wireless broadband internet connection and a 32/37 inch LCD flat screen television.

name: Covered Wagon Ranch
overview: One of the oldest continuously operating guest ranches in this canyon. Here you will stay in historic log cabins with their original 1920's charm with wood-burning stoves, rustic wood furniture and private baths.

name: Hyatt Regency Buffalo
overview: Convenient to the Theater District. One of Buffalo's finest business hotels. 3 bars and restaurants including Atrium Bar & Bistro, E. B. Green's Steakhouse, and Starbucks. Spa, fitness club, business center. Connected to Buffalo Convention Center.

name: Elmeiz Place Guest House
overview: Bed & breakfast, a charming guest house operating almost entirely on solar power in the comfortable neighborhood of Dansoman. 20 min drive from Kotoka International Airport. Cosy and modern.

name: Bosques de Cocora campground
overview: The one official campground in the park is right at the entrance, behind the little roadside restaurant run by the same people. You'll need your own tent, but they do have showers and flush toilets. For an extra fee, you can get meals included at the restaurant.

name: Jos Cafe & Rooms
overview: Rooms are En-Suite with complementary Wi-Fi.

name: Hotel Eremitage
overview: Upscale hotel located at the '''Hermitage''' (''Eremitage'').

name: Al Saeed Hotel
overview: Used to be a Sofitel.  Perched on a hill top overlooking the city.  A very good almost 4 star hotel.  It is the best in the city and possibly in the country.  It has clean and modern rooms, wireless internet throughout (bad signal in the rooms though).  Swimming pool.

name: Albany/Corvallis KOA
overview: Located halfway between Albany and Corvallis, this KOA offers parking for RV's, rental cabins, and tent camping. Guests can enjoy the outdoors in this clean and well maintained environment, including a pool, playground, snack bar, mini golf, TV's and free wifi. Don't forget to sign up for a value card to get special deals and perks each time you stay KOA grounds.

name: The George Walker House
overview: A historic house which has been fully restored and available on a nightly basis. The caretakers live in a separate house next door. Fully equipped, no television but free wi-fi.

name: Porteau Cove Legacy Cabins
address: Hwy 99 - Porteau Cove PP (see directions above)
overview: Log cabins that were built for the 2010 Winter Olympics and now available for the public to use. The cabins are one bedroom with a loft and can handle up to four occupants. They're set just back from the beach at Porteau Cove with a deck that provides views of Howe Sound and the Tantalus Range. Other amenities include a stove, mini-fridge, BBQ, microwave and three piece bathroom.

name: Villa Ditya
address: Gang Sido Rejo, RT 02 RW 05, Trunuh
overview: Villa Ditya is a luxurious private holiday villa with swimming pool and staff near Yogyakarta. Villa Ditya has 3 bedrooms with air conditioning, 1 bedroom with fan, 2 bathrooms, a large L-shaped living room and a spacious kitchen.

name: Dráva Hotel
overview: A nice four star hotel with Conference Hall for events. 89 rooms with double bed, twin bed, two plus one bed in classic, superior, premium and suite categories, all with private bathroom, air-conditioner, television, minibar, telephone and a some of them with a balcony too. There is a air conditioned restaurant,-open daily 07.00–22.00,-for max 200 people with four separable rooms (when requested), buffet service and a’la carte menu is available.

name: Emmaus Retreat & Conference Centre
overview: The centre welcomes people who wish to take time out to find meaning in their lives. It sits on 10 acres of rural grounds with tree-lined paths, landscaped gardens and a river walk. It offers modern accommodation in 62 ensuite rooms, some of which are wheelchair accessible. Rates include breakfast, toiletries, WiFi, and use of the dining, oratory and prayer rooms.

name: Hotel Palace
overview: Operated by the local company Tallinn Hotels, the Hotel Palace is stuated in a 1937 buildinging with a stark gray period facade, somewhat contrasting with its name. The interiors have been refurbished in mid-2014 and now feature furniture and fixtures reminiscent of the interwar period. The art-deco theme is continued in the use of motifs from paintings of Konrad Mägi, a famous Estonian painter whose lifetime covered the turn of the 19th and 20th centuries.

name: Madison
overview: (06-May to 30-Oct). 277 sites, flush toilets, RV dump station.

name: Stellamaris
overview: Town house 5 minutes walk from Swords Main Street, 5 minutes drive from Dublin Airport and 30 minutes from Dublin City Centre. Frequent buses. Good taxi service. Car parking.

name: White Porch Inn
overview: A boutique contemporary B&B in Provincetown.

name: Best Western Bromma
overview: At Bromma Airport.

name: Best Western Plus Kings Inn & Suites
overview: Free breakfast and wi-fi, laundry facilities and gym.

name: Nakties Magija Hotel
overview: The hotel is in Žaliakalnis district, near Azuolynas park. It offers 10 modern rooms..

name: Maroochy River Resort & Bungalows
overview: Self contained family holiday cabins. Private boat ramp, kayaks, tennis, bbqs, pools, sunlounges. Close to the action but away from the rat race.

name: Vienna Sporthotel
overview: Spa and Tennis possibilities.

name: Miyazawa Kaigan Auto Campground
overview: This resort and campground is rather expensive, but it is well-situated on the beach in northern Oga.  There are campsites and cabins, and also an onsen for bathing.

name: Villa Margareta Novalja
overview: Red, Green and Blue apartments. Free Internet access.

name: Masirah Hotel
overview: Onsite restaurant, free wi-fi.

name: Culloden House Hotel
overview: Beautiful Country House Hotel set 3 miles out of the city centre, great food, magnificent rooms. Culloden House is where Bonny Prince Charlie slept, the night before the Battle of Culloden in 1746.

name: Intercontinental Frankfurt
overview: Major business hotel and conference centre for international travelers. Also home to loads of conventions. Amazing view from club rooms over the city.

name: Burrendale Hotel
overview: Good 4-star hotel with 68 bedrooms and spa and conference facilities. Some distance from the town centre on the road towards Castlewellan.

name: Alpine View Lodge
overview: Surrounded by mountains.

name: ACCOMMODATION BOVEC KOT 33
overview: Bovec kot 33 accommodations offers unique experience of Bovec. Free parking, Free WiFi. Bathroom, shower, kitchen, tv from 17,50/person/night

name: Finger Lakes Premier Properties - Canandaigua/Honeoye
overview: Finger Lakes Vacation Rentals (mini-weeks, full weeks, extended stays) and real estate. Specializing in lake front properties.

name: Artistic Bed & Breakfast
overview: Conveniently located in the center of Madrid, a quiet bed and breakfast with a unique style and decoration.

name: Kaniyu
overview: A lost hotel in the mountains with 8 hotsprings, 7 of which are mixed and/or private baths.  You can eat bear sashimi and share a bath with your partner, watching the stars, river and waterfall.

name: Mathias Guestrooms
overview: Two rooms (2+1 bed and 2+2 beds) bed linen are provided, refrigerator, satellite TV.

name: DuPont Lodge
overview: is located within the park and has 51 rooms available.  The park also has 26 Cottages and 20 Woodland Rooms available for rent.  The Cottages come in one and two bedroom configurations.  They feature fireplaces and full kitchens.  The Woodland Rooms are duplex units and have two queen sized beds along with a partial kitchen (refrigerator, sink, and microwave).  The lodge, Cottages, and Woodland Rooms are available year round.  Reservations can be made through the park website up to one year in advance.

name: Embassy Suites Portland Airport
overview: Conveniently located at the entrance to the Portland International Airport.

name: Alila Jakarta
overview: Modern, airy lobby and rooms.

name: Sea-Change Living
address: Ty Bryn Adda, Vaynol Park, Y Felinheli, Bangor, LL57 4BP
overview: A peaceful secluded B&B in North Wales, 5 minutes from the Menai Strait, and surrounded by fields and woodland. With 3 bedrooms, walkers, cyclists, artists and birdwatchers are welcomed. This B&B is conveniently located for visiting Bangor University staff and is located 10 minutes away from the soon to be opened 'Pontio' arts complex in Bangor and 'Y Galeri' in Caernarfon.

name: Sweet-Hostel Nis'
overview: is another hostel in Nis. It is located in the center of town, only 5 minutes from ''The square of King Milan'' (main city square). They offer comfortable rooms and welcoming, hospitable service for a small amount of money. Hot showers and free towels are there as well, as is a fully equipped kitchen and a shared room with TV, DVD & very slow Internet access.

name: Marble Hill Farms
overview: Rustic eco-lodge, small casitas with kitchenettes, bunk lodging and package pricing including diving and lodging. New fishing and diving boats, numerous activities; diving and kite boarding, strolling through the gardens, and tasting homemade jams and jellies. Includes the Crow's Nest restaurant. Backpacker dorms with bunk beds and common bathrooms. Casitas – cabin style rooms with double beds and private bathrooms. Condo style rooms with double beds and private bathrooms.

name: Hotel Sopianae
overview: Mobile: +36 30 637-8444 - free facilities: internet connection in each room, fitness equipments, at request breakfast room service. - Additional facilities: half board dinner (at the nearby Fiáker Restaurant), closed parking, sauna, bathrobe, biliard room, massage, laundry.

name: Holiday Club Tampere
overview: A hotel/spa next to a marina, about 1 km from the city center. Built into an old cotton mill with high rooms.

name: St. Regis Princeville Resort
overview: For those who want to pay for something spectacular this is arguably the island's nicest resort.  The views are incredible, especially of sunset from the spectacular lobby lounge.  The hotel was renovated in 2009 and offers a modern look with great attention to detail. Even if you do not have the budget to stay here, you can reach the beach by walking along the hotel's sidewalk - look for spots marked for public access to the left of the entrance station.

name: Hotel Carlton
overview: This hotel was formerly the Hilton Madagascar, and is now a member hotel within Summit Hotels & Resorts. It is not known whether the new affiliation has caused significant changes, but at least one traveller reports that it is a great hotel by European standards. The Carlton boasts 2 restaurants (Cafe Charly is reportedly excellent), 2 bars and an internet cafe, some rooms have nice views of the lake, and it is near the football (meaning soccer) stadium. 170 rooms.

name: Akha River House
overview: 20 rooms. Mud-style house with bamboo furniture. Free Wi-Fi and lots of space to relax outside. On the bank of the Mae Kok River. It has a nice restaurant and their staff are very friendly. They organise a great jungle trek. Free Wi-Fi. Laundry service.

name: Explorers Inn
overview: 24 hour reception

name: Hótel Holt
overview: By a quiet street in the centre of town. When it opened in 1965 the hotel restaurant was one of the first fine dining locations in Reykjavík.

name: Ibis Jakarta Cawang
overview: Probably the best hotel in East Jakarta. The local brand has already made you safe staying here. Good rooms, good options for breakfast.

name: Hotel Torbräu
overview: Oldest hotel in town (since 1490). Traditional, family-run hotel with 90 rooms and free Internet

name: Best Western Plus Creekside
overview: 100 rooms with balcony (view towards Tudor Creek or the garden). Wi-Fi in the bar. Conference room. Pool.

name: Chalet Backpackers
overview: 10 min walk to the Octagon. Beds, not bunks - and no more than 5 people in the largest room!

name: Baan Chantra
overview: Baan Chantra is an upmarket hotel in a beautiful Thai historic home dating from 1936. The front rooms overlook the busy road, but it is relatively quiet at night. The rooms are spotless with ensuites, air conditioning, mini-bar and a full breakfast. The staff is very helpful.

name: Comfort Suites Linn County Fairground and Expo
overview: This chain hotel is located next to the airport and fairgrounds. Rooms are large, clean and have the standard hotel necessities such as a coffee maker, shower and bathtub, TV with cable, etc. Pets welcome for an extra charge. There is also a heated pool, laundry facilities, and a workout gym. Breakfast is additional, and wifi is free. They also have a shuttle that will pick you up at the airport and bring you back in Portland! Be sure to check for AAA, senior, and military discounts.

name: Maria Exaltacion Lodge
overview: (8) multi~colored rooms; (6) square~meters wide, fully air~conditioned, with 2 double beds, cable~TV, bathtub, heated shower, free Wi~Fi and back~up lighting generator.

name: Douglas Arms Hotel
overview: "The hotel has been tastefully modernised to meet the standards of today's traveller whilst retaining many of its original features.   The coaching credentials and the hotels reputation for hospitality have been well known over the years. The Douglas Arms Hotel is a warm and welcoming retreat for all."

name: Hostal de la Barra
overview: This hostel is run directly in an old building in the middle of Neighborhood Bellas Artes, it has high quality infrastructure and also has a very nice coffee shop next door where the breakfast is served: The drawback is the six lane road outside which is rarely quiet and the early morning revellers returning home. Sleep is at a premium here. Good points are the staff, the location and the park areas nearby

name: Ibis Lome Centre Hotel
overview: French run and the food is excellent.

name: Pension Aviano
overview: Small pension. Good breakfast, very friendly to families with toddler (except a small staircase prior to elevator). Free grog for guests in the afternoon. Free excellent wifi in all rooms. Helpful reception most of the time, also in finding a right place to eat. Comfortable for non-smokers.

name: Roskilde Camping
overview: Located some 4 km from the town center, directly at the fjord. The camping site also offers cabins for rent. Open from end of March to end of September.

name: Hotel Nexus
overview: Free wi-fi, outdoor pool, complimentary scheduled shuttle service, and free room service from the on-site Indian restaurant, Saffron Grill.

name: Minshuku Kohama-sō
overview: One of the longest-running lodges on the island, with both hotel and hostel style accommodation.  ¥500 discount for HI members.

name: Newhaven Guest House
address: Plot 16, Gowers Rd (now re-named to Julia Sebutinde Road)
overview: Ten Queen-bedded rooms in the family compound of retired local civil servants means that you are assured of all the local insider tips. Peace of mind comes from knowing that you are looked after by the family's personal household. Bedrooms and shower rooms are tiled and comfortably furnished; mosquito netting is unusually comprehensive. There is a relaxing garden with mango, orange, paw-paw, guava, avocado and tangerine trees and the pineapple served at your breakfast will probably have only had to travel 20m. The view from both the main house and the front garden over the lush suburban gardens of Bugonga as the sun sets over Lake Victoria makes a fine coda to your day. Free Wi-Fi. Credit cards not accepted. Airport meet and greet service is USD10.

name: Camping du Mont Serein
overview: 1410 meters high, north face of Mont Ventoux

name: nitenite
overview: The property brands itself as a boutique hotel, where postmodern common space appointments are meant to make up for the ultrasmall (7 sqm) cabins that serve as ensuite rooms.

name: Centara Koh Chang Tropicana Resort
overview: Large resort with 157 rooms in small cottages. Near the beach. Several pools, restaurants and bars. Free Wi-Fi in public areas. Kids Club, babysitting. Most rooms can accommodate 3-4 people.

name: Branston Hall Hotel
overview: Country house hotel situated in parkland with its own lake

name: Baitello dell'Amicizia
overview: A mountain shelter built and managed by ANA Esino Lario.

name: Mercure Hotel Koblenz
overview: Reasonable sized rooms with good breakfast. Can be busy and expensive in holiday period.

name: Where 2 Next – Manila Hostel
overview: Where 2 Next is a new and modern hostel owned by two Filipino-Australian sisters. Where2Next has 24 hour reception, Internet access, A/C, luggage lockers, linens and towels, cable TV, a common room, kitchen, and free WI FI.

name: Lake Sunset
overview: This place has many cabins for rental.  There are cabins for 1-2, 3-4, 4-5, or 6-8 people.  There is also an attached restaurant.

name: Hotel Hermica
overview: Hotel located in neighborhood of Hervanta, near Tampere University of Technology. Price changes according to the season

name: The Pure
overview: Puristic but excellent Design Hotel north side of central station. A must stay for every style fan with fancy lounge, great cocktails & attentive staff

name: Det Hanseatiske Hotel
overview: Finnegaarden 2 A. Situated in the very heart of the historic Bergen, the hotel building was rebuilt after the great fire in 1702, but is mentioned in texts dating back to the beginning of the 15th century. It is part of the [[UNESCO World Heritage Site]] [[Bergen#Bryggen|Bryggen]]. With 37 rooms, the hotel opened in May 2006 and has quickly gained renown for its historic atmosphere.

name: Residencial Millenio
address: Centre of town, close to Águila cinema
overview: Indian style. Rooms with bathroom. Restaurant outside. Safe parking. Breakfast basic.

name: La Maison du Pyla
overview: This bed and breakfast is popular with researchers and NGOs, which makes for interesting conversation at meal times. The owner bakes homemade bread at breakfast time and is very attentive to guest needs and can help with travel arrangements including airport shuttles and reservation confirmations. The three story building is a bit old, but is kept clean and in good repair. Meals are generous, the wi-fi works well, and the homemade infused rums are well worth a try.

name: Best Western Premium Freeport Inn and Suites
overview: Very close to airport. Pool with waterslide. Airport shuttle, free breakfast.

name: Hotel Maison de Ville
overview: Is one of the most historic hotels in the Quarter, everyone from Tennessee Williams to Audobon has spent time there.

name: The Renaissance Hotel
overview: Boutique hotel and restaurant with cable television and restaurant.

name: Omni Parker House Hotel
overview: The oldest hotel in America. Located in downtown Boston on the Freedom Trail, the venerable Omni Parker House Hotel opened its doors in 1855. If you want to surround yourself in history in the heart of Downtown Boston, this is THE place to stay. However, note that many of the hotel's rooms are small and over-crowded with furniture. Ho Chi Minh & Malcolm X are former employees. Bonus: If you eat in the dining room, ask to sit in the booth in which JFK asked Jackie O to marry him.

name: Alpokalja Pension
overview: Rooms with with a shower and a refrigerator. Free WiFi, a garden with barbecue facilities and a 24-hour reception.

name: Pousada Guarana
overview: Pousada Guarana is a quiet and tranquil B&B located in a residential neighborhood, 20-minute walk from the city center and away from loud streets. Owned by Brazilian wife and American husband. The inn is full of amazing artistic touches, the rooms are huge and comfy, and the daily poolside breakfast is fantastic.

name: La Chimba Hostel
overview: Small award-winning budget with friendly staff and great facilities. Near Metro Baquedano, La Chascona, Cerro San Cristobal and the city's best bars and restaurants.

name: Crowne Plaza Monterrey
overview: Large corporate-style hotel with large clean rooms, indoor swimming, 24-hour business center and more. Good location on very busy road, one block to Macroplaza

name: Check Inn
overview: 50 air con spacious and clean rooms in this recently decorated hotel. Cable TV, free Internet in rooms, laundry, restaurant.

name: The Glenforsa Hotel
overview: This small family run hotel captures the spirit of Mull and is a perfect rural holiday retreat. The mountain and sea blend together to give fantastic, panoramic views from the hotel which is in an elevated position on the shoreline. Panoramic views are also available from the bar and restaurant which serves local produce 7 days a week.

name: Kaunas City Camping
overview: Kaunas City Camping is located just off the Vilnius-Klaipėda motorway north of downtown on the right bank of the Neris river. Kaunas camping offers places for 50 motor homes and an area to pitch tents. Electricity, washing facilities are available. Kaunas Old town is reachable from camping by bus #20. Prices: tents LTL15 (€4,4) /person, vehicles LTL34 (€10) /person, double chalets LTL100 (€29).

name: Hotel Sea Hawk
overview: One of the few places in town that doesn't hike up their prices as demand increases. Food is moderately good and room services standard.

name: Seal View
overview: Offers 1 family room, sleeping up to four (with private bath). Panoramic views of sea, mountains and basking seals.

name: Guesthouse Firyz
overview: Twelve rooms. All rooms have private bathroom, telephone, TV, mini-bar, air conditioning, hair dryer, and we have tried to provide all the other stuff, that is, a bathrobe and clothes brush.  - "Lux",  "Junior Suite" rooms

name: Hotel Malak Mahal
overview: 2-year-old hotel as of 2014. The hotel has 45 rooms, an in-house restaurant, reserved parking space and they offer free Wi-Fi, AC rooms with attached washroom and a nice guest service system.

name: Scandic CH
overview: Arguably the best hotel in town, at least the most expensive. Located between the train station and city center.

name: Thon Hotel Ålesund
overview: Kongensgate 27;

name: Camping Haller **
overview: ''Each 4th night is free!''

name: Gjestehuset 102
overview: Miner's lodge converted into a basic but comfortable guesthouse, with shared bathrooms and lounge/kitchen; the main downside is the location, a 20-min walk from downtown. It is however well serviced by the airport shuttle bus. S

name: Niras Bankoc Hostel & Coffee
overview: This is a great hostel as it is close to most attractions and to Khao San Rd, while still in a quiet folk neighbourhood. Walking to the Grand Palace takes about 30 min over some larger roads, but you can easily hail taxis. There are private rooms and dorm rooms with 4-6 people. Rooms are clean and decent, and the interior is in an interesting colonial style. The vintage coffee shop offers good quality coffee and Thai tea. Free Wi-Fi.

name: Relais des Plateaux
overview: The main draw of this hotel is its location ten minutes from the airport and its free shuttle, saving travelers with stopovers the headache of spending an hour in traffic trying to reach a downtown hotel. It is clean, has a pool, a decent restaurant, hot showers, working wi-fi, and the amenities one would expect in a good hotel. The downside is that it is very expensive for what you get, with small, pod-like rooms, no extra amenities, and little to see or do in the immediate neighborhood.

name: Bridgewater Retreat
overview: Historic log house and sixteen cabins on Skootamata River for $90-300, adults-only, non-smoking, former artists colony suitable for groups.

name: Abri du voyageur Hotel
overview: Charming hotel for budget-conscious travellers in the heart of Downtown Montreal. Renovated historical building recommended by many guides as an excellent value with a personal touch.

name: Elga´s Punk Rock Hostel
overview: Probably the best choice among the hotels you can find in this lively, grungy town, with nice wooden rooms, fair showers and a great couple running the place. Be prepared, though, to acoustically participate in the pleasures your neighbours are enjoying.

name: La Jolla Valley Campground
address: 2.6 Mile hike from Thornehill Broome Beach via Loop Trail
overview: A small walk-in campground on the La Jolla Valley Loop trail. Space is extremely limited, and reservations may be difficult to come by. Hike-in access only.

name: Fisher House Victoria Bed and Breakfast
overview: Comfortable, quiet accommodations in a boutique setting.

name: Sheraton Minneapolis West Hotel
overview: Located across from Ridgedale Mall, and just 10 minutes from downtown Minneapolis. Hotel includes an indoor pool and full-service Atrium Bistro.

name: Albergo Ristorante Villa Cipressi
overview: 43 rooms, 97 beds. 2 conference rooms and access to the beautiful botanical garden.

name: Bristol Hotel
overview: A contemporary and casual hotel, the Bristol features an unusually large pop art collection.

name: Hotel Sacher
overview: This hotel is best known as the place where Sachertorte (cake) was invented. The elegant drawing room is a popular place to gather after a performance at the opera. The food is pricey but definitely worth the money. The rooms offer old style luxury with heavy carpets.

name: Radisson Blu Elizabete Hotel
overview: Contemporary styling in the heart of the city.

name: Tena Adam Hotel
overview: Probably the only hotel in Lalibela which charges the same price for foreigners and Ethiopians. There is no bargaining even on major holidays. Prices during Christmas and other holidays are the same. Rooms are comfortable with sturdy beds and blankets. The common bathroom is clean and can accommodate many guests at the same time for those using the toilet and cold shower. The owner is Befekadu Sisay.

name: Argishti Hotel
overview: The hotel "Argishti" is a three-storey building, located in the center of Vanadzor Town. The interior part of the hotel has been designed with the elements of the national style and coloring. The hotel rooms have bathrooms, with all necessary components, refrigerators, color TVs, satellite, telephones and hair-driers. It has an International telephone communication.

name: Hotel Indigo
overview: Boutique hotel in the City Centre; Marco Pierre White restaurant on-site.

name: Skovshoved Hotel
overview: Historic beach hotel with more than 350 years on its back, but has recently been thoroughly renovated. Most of the 22 rooms have fantastic views over the Øresund strait. The restaurant has a the Michelin stamp of approval, and is a destination in its own right -  excellent but expensive.

name: Stangwrach Self-catering Cottage
overview: Stone cottage c. 1756 sleeping 4+2 near both the market town of Carmarthen and the historical town of Llandeilo (7 miles), centrally heated throughout.

name: Grand Hotel de Vianden
overview: Just away from the crowds, not far from the starting point of the télésiège, this place offers friendly service and spacious, even when a tiny bit outdated, rooms. There's no elevator, but there's free parking around.

name: The Convent Bed and Breakfast
overview: The convent is a bed and breakfast providing lodging and breakfast for vistitors to val marie saskatchewan and canada grasslands national park.

name: Lane Cove River Tourist Park - caravan park
overview: Locate at Lane Cove National Park, this tourist park is surrounded by nature, yet it has easy access to Sydney CBD by train. This is the closest camping site to Sydney CBD. It offers many options for accommodation and organises tours in the Sydney area.

name: Rosengarten Hotel, Restaurant, Dental and Beauty Salon
overview: offering a full range of services in dental tourism to its guests. free phones from abroad= Austria: 0 800 293545, Germany: 0 800 1813637, Switzerland: 0 800 563577. - Twenty four,-standard, superior, deluxe,-a/c rooms. - Here is a 350-seat Restaurant with a winter garden, banquet room and terrace. Also here is a Beauty Salon with a wide variety of sevices (hairdressing, cosmetic treatments, manicure, pedicure, artificial nail, massage and body treatments), the Wellness/Turkish bath part include infrasauna, scented steam bath, adventure shower and solarium.

name: Backpackers Nirvana
overview: Rooms with shower or bathtub. Campsite. Also offers "holistic and alternative therapies".

name: Brook Lane Hostel
overview: One of two hostels in the city and the only one in the very heart of town and a very inexpensive alternative to a hotel. It has all hostel style amenities, inlcluding an in-house supermarket. Furthermore, it's the only hostel in Regensburg that allows guest over the age of 26.

name: Civic Center Hotel
overview: Furnished rooms with a sink in each room (no televisions). Only metered street parking is available at the hotel.

name: ibis Budget Birmingham Centre
overview: Offering perhaps the cheapest hotel stays in Birmingham, the ibis Budget is a chain hotel optimized for low costs, with very simply appointed rooms with just enough space.

name: Jet Pak City
overview: Award-winning popular hostel.

name: Aloha Beach Resort
overview: Kapaa. (route 56 near Lydgate Beach Park just south of the bridge over the Wailua River). Provides family-friendly accommodations, with educational programs featuring various aspects of Native Hawaiian culture. Two pools. Enclosed ocean area at Lydgate Beach Park within walking distance, snorkel gear available for rent. Friendly front desk staff. (Tip: booking through their website provides the best rates.) Rooms about average size, some wear and tear on the furniture. $85-259 double with garden and ocean views available. $220-359 cottages.

name: Bicycle Youth Hostel
overview: A youth hostel mostly used by bicyclists. Neat, cheap and near the city centre.

name: Alchymist Grand Hotel and Spa
overview: Very luxurious, and rather expensive hotel located across the street from the U.S. Embassy.

name: Holiday Inn Stuttgart
overview: Good quality rooms. One of the best breakfast buffets in town. Friendly, helpful and efficient staff. On the edge of town but with S-Bahn station next to hotel.

name: The Poet Hotel Amsterdam
overview: A new boutique hotel in Zuid, just around the corner from Museumplein.

name: Grand Asia Hotel
overview: One of the best hotels at the Pluit area. Contemporary Asian minimalist interior. Executive lobby lounge,''Cathay'' Chinese restaurant and ''The Cafe'' international cuisine. ''Dragon Phoenix'' lounge for a karaoke and bar.

name: Rambutan
overview: A true "backpacker" hostel. Provides house instruments to play with, free towels to use, and a bike you can borrow. A huge garden and terraces to enjoy.

name: Microtel West Albuquerque
overview: Basic chain motel on the edge of town. Stay if you're just passing through on I-40 or heading out of town the next day, but not if you're going to be exploring Albuquerque.

name: The Dharmawangsa
address: Jl. Brawijaya Raya No. 26, Kebayoran Baru
overview: A short quiet hotel in the suburbs (almost city-like) within walking distance (use a shortcut) to Kemang, perfect for honeymooners or leisure travelers. Each room has a personal butler with Javanese standard hospitality. The rooms are wide (except for the small TV), while the bathroom has a large tub and a his and hers sink. Dine at the many delectable restaurants of the hotel or delight yourself with the chocolate martini and many other collections of cognac and spirits at the bar. For a pamper, head to the spa, to the pool (both indoor and outdoor), or just see the garden.

name: Kanha Eco Lodge
address: Unit of Kanha Village Eco Resort, Near Kanha national park, Village Boda Chhapri, Panchayat Mocha, Kanha 481768
overview: Kanha Eco Lodge is an eco friendly budget wildlife lodge for wildlife enthusiasts and tourists alike. With 8 mud houses having modern amenities it is a perfect place to enjoy trip to Kanha national park in an economic way. It has a multi cuisine restaurant, swimming pool, TV lounge and serves Jain food also.

name: Palms Casino Hotel
overview: A great view of the Strip from the Ghostbar. A Maloof casino.

name: Hotel Aldi
overview: Fresh, modern family-run hotel.

name: Royal Street Inn B&B
overview: "B&B" here may stand for "Bed and Beverage", as this is upstairs from the R-Bar.

name: The Fairmont
overview: A great hotel, but it only has ocean views.

name: ITC Grand Central
overview: This extremely posh hotel is also suitably expensive.  - '''Kebabs and Curries Restaurant''': Spectacular Indian food. They serve the famous Delhi Bukhara curry at this ITC restaurant. Try their succulent kebabs, their thick-enough-to-cut dal bukhara, or their fantastic Indian breads. Expect to empty out your wallets at this place, each dish can be Rs 1000. -

name: Jambo Village Hotel
overview: Singles, doubles, triples. Rates include breakfast. Conference room, bar and restaurant.

name: Tri Korony
overview: A mid-range resort a little from the city centre. Friendly hotel with 60 rooms at low quality with products from China. Run down pool, but great beach and descent prices with full board.

name: Vinnitsa Hotel
overview: - 25 rooms /52 beds. - Wi-Fi

name: Sunset Motel
overview: 25 motel units opened in November 2003.

name: Grise Fiord Inuit Lodge
overview: Located in Grise Fiord, this lodge with 24 beds is one of few accommodations available. Meals are included in the rates.

name: Tiger Islands Village & Eco Resort
address: Departure from Ancol Marina pier no. 6
overview: Built by an American. 9 cottages to choose from or you can camp. There are fans but no air conditioning, television, or WiFi, instead play a billiard pool, badminton, or water sports! As its name suggests, it collects rainwater for all the water supplies, and grows its own vegetables. There is a separate sand island for you to sunbathe at.

name: Sabrina Hostel
overview: breakfast is included.

name: Hotel New Otani
overview: The flagship of the New Otani chain, worth a visit just for the gorgeous gardens alone.  It's a bit of a hike to the nearest subway station though.

name: Résid Hotel Diamarek
overview: This small hotel with friendly staff is situated along the Route de Hydrobase and also right on the beach of the Langue de Barbarie Peninsula, set in a garden of 2 and a half acres the hotel offers basic rooms as well as lovely bungalows right along the ocean. Hotel has A/C, fans, generator, hot water, electricity, and no mosquito nets. Reception speaks French and English.

name: Åkeshovs Slott
overview: ''Åkeshofs Slott'', also a palace.

name: SummitCove.com Keystone Resort Lodging
overview: Keystone's largest independent property management company.

name: Sleep Inn
overview: A Pet Friendly hotel which offers free airport transportation.

name: Mon Coeur Yamato
overview: A Japanese-run pension located conveniently in the Echoland area (English support available).  All rooms have en-suite bathrooms and cooked breakfasts are an optional extra.

name: Hotel Fürstenhof
overview: Starwood hotel. 650 m² spa.

name: MainStay Suites
overview: An extended stay hotel.

name: Holiday Inn Dubai - Al Barsha
address: Near Mall of The Emirates, E11 Sheikh Zayed Rd
overview: 4-star hotel.

name: Pushpa Guesthouse
overview: Popular and friendly budget guesthouse in good location just off the main lakeside road.

name: Chomrong Cottage
overview: Run by a pleasant family and rightly famous for their food including their chocolate cake that they bake fresh every day. Singles/Doubles with common bathroom Rs100/200 Two rooms with ensuite.

name: Natura Villa Resort and Spa
overview: Overlooking Petanu River.

name: Drop in Chalets
overview: Set back in a large private garden with panoramic views of Mont Blanc Chalet Cachat is a Savoie style chalet with large open plan living and dining area full of character.

name: Hotel Miralrio
overview: Free WiFi, cable TV, private restrooms and a garden with all kind of flowers and trees. Clean rooms and secured private parking, , rooms have direct view to the lake and volcanoes, staff is friendly and speak some English

name: Barony House B&B
overview: a cheerful B&B located just outside the town

name: Nishime Yukkoland
overview: This 24-hour hotel and onsen is designed for people on the move.  It's clean, inexpensive, and located on the highway.

name: Falkensteiner Hotel Wien Margareten
overview: Opened in 2013 it is designed by architect Matteo Thun. It offers free Wi-Fi, a sauna, and a steam bath.

name: Bol apartments
overview: Bol Apartments on best locations in Bol. Only newly refurbished and luxury apartments on offer. Also villas with swimming pool.

name: Entebbe Gateway Inn
overview: This must be one of the very few lodgings where the rooms are much nicer than the rather dilapidated entrance and reception. They're tiled, clean and all ''en suite'' but only have mosquito nets over the beds as opposed to across the windows. Satellite TV in the room and Wi-Fi in the reception area is included in the tariff. Rather noisy and insecure since it's behind the Pearl Supermarket.

name: The Ritz-Carlton
overview: One of the world's most expensive cities, be prepared to pay at the Ritz Carlton. Although completed in 2007, the 19th century styling looks authentic with an old world style, look and feel.

name: Dragør Fort
overview: Unique accommodation in an old fort from 1915. Renovations to turn this into a event and conference centre are ongoing, and the owners have created seven fairly nice and big double rooms in the process — each with television sets and private bathrooms.

name: Shanghai Mansion Bangkok
overview: Probably the only boutique hotel in Yaowarat. It tries to give the visitor the experience of being in a 1930s Shanghai merchant's house. The rooms are designed in a colourful Chinese style with bright walls and silk lights. Breakfast is included and Wi-Fi is available.

name: Clarion Hotel Prague Old Town
overview: Near Old Town Square Modern equipment and services in a historic building dating back to 1930. Recently completely renovated rooms have internet, free WiFi in common areas.

name: B&B Torre dello Ziro
overview: Located between Ravello and Amalfi, in the heart of the Amalfi Coast, Torre Dello Ziro dates back to the 18th century. It offers romantically decorated interiors surrounded by lemon groves. Rooms at Torre Dello Ziro are bright and spacious. All air conditioned, they feature elegant furniture, tiled floors and modern amenities such as flat-screen TVs and Wi-Fi and wired internet access, both free. Breakfast is served in the cost dining room or out on the terrace with views across the Mediterranean Sea. Ravello and Amalfi are both around 5 minutes' drive away, while Positano is 20 km away along the coast. You can reach the port of Salerno in around 30 minutes by car.

name: Hotel Indonesia Kempinski
overview: Most likely the first ''splurge'' hotel built in Jakarta for the 1962 Asian Games. Nestled in front of the infamous roundabout for its namesake. Renovated sleek and spacious rooms. Despite the renovation and handover to the chain brand, the hotel still lefts a portion of its heyday heritage. 6 restaurants, including the Paulaner German brewery. Accessible from Grand Indonesia as well.

name: Park Inn by Radisson
overview: Kaunas’ largest hotel in very central location with largest conference and event centre in Kaunas. 4 star hotel has 208 air-conditioned rooms in Northern European style.

name: The Lodge at Torrey Pines
overview: Rustic alpine-style hotel adjacent to the PGA Championship Torrey Pines Golf Corse. This is a high-end resort and spa. The A. R. Valentien restaurant, named for the California artist, overlooks the 18th hole of the Torrey Pines golf course. Works by Valentien are on exhibit throughout the dining room.

name: Sea Garden Mazatlan
overview: Beach and Golf Luxury resort with 3 swimming pools, spa, tennis court, gym.

name: Mountain of the Moon Hotel
overview: A top high-end tourist hotel on the way to Queen Elizabeth National Park. The food is overpriced and bad. Wifi, restaurant, bar, conference, pool, gym.

name: Camping Füred
overview: Tennis, minigolf and several sports grounds A big water slide free of charge, sandy beach. Water-skiing. Night pool parties, music and dance shows. - Services: English spoken German spoken. Dogs are not allowed, Bungalows, Mobile home. Rent a bike. Rent a gocart. Water sports equipment for hire. Animation. Swimming pool. Childrens' pool. Lounge with TV. Water-skiing course. Playground. Marked fishing places. Marina. Mini lido for children. Football place. Tennis. Windsurf. Beach volleyball. Streetball. Minigolf. Table tennis. Trampoline. Cooking plate.Basins with free hot-water use Hot-water showers Bathrooms for disabled people. Bathroom for children. Restaurant. Bar. Buffet. Shops. Change. Organised events. Internet. Free WIFI. Safe deposits Dishwasher sink. Washing room. Massage. Hairdresser. Camp day. VISA accepted. MasterCard accepted.

name: Scandic Hotel Uplandia
overview: Located downtown near the train station.

name: Patra Semarang
overview: Resort-style hotel is in the hilly area of Candi Baru

name: Radisson Blu Bosphorus Hotel, Istanbul
overview: 120 rooms and 7 meeting rooms with technical equipment, wellness center, and underground parking. The hotel has one all day dining restaurant, one bar and a private venue that highlight the city as Starboard Restaurant offers a spectacular Bosphorus view; "Cruise Lounge & Bar", with its scenery; and "Pupa Terrace", a venue for private events, dinners, or cocktails.

name: Népliget Sport Hostel
overview: Sporthostel ideal place for athletes, individual travelers and all those who want to stay quiet and / or athletic environment at an affordable price! The Hostel located in the south-east of Budapest, the city's largest park. +phone=+36 1 2350173.

name: Suanthip Vana Resort
address: 49 Chiang Mai-Chiang Rai Rd, Takok, Mae Suay
overview: Very isolated retreat. Beautiful buildings in Lanna style, especially the Pkakeryor villas.

name: The Sheraton Grand Hotel
overview: 21 Festival Square. Against the backdrop of majestic Edinburgh Castle, the Sheraton Grand Hotel and Spa combines city centre convenience with warm Scottish hospitality.

name: Hilton Tel Aviv
overview: This is the first major 5-star international hotel in the city.

name: Hotel de Niro
address: Sts. Cyril and Methodi (Св. Кирил и Методиј) 5
overview: - is located in the very heart of Bitola. It contains 6 double, 7 triple and 2 luxury equipped suites. The hotel is 10 km from [[Pelister National Park]]. Every room is built in the old spirit and possesses all conveniences.

name: Tyax Lodge
overview: Log frame resort with 29 resort rooms, a lakeside chalet and lakeside campground. The front lawn provides views of Tyaughton Lake and has beach volleyball, lawn chairs and ample space for just relaxing. There is also a private dock with free canoe and paddleboat rentals. The campground has electrical hook-ups and campers can use the shower facilities in the lodge.

name: Les Victorines du lac
overview: 17-room country inn with dining room, meeting facilities for up to thirty people.

name: Comfort Suites Raleigh Durham Airport/RTP
overview: Located by the Raleigh-Durham International Airport.

name: Lotus 1 Guest House
overview: Popular amongst backpackers and offers the usual Indonesian budget set-up. Lotus I is just 100 m from the entrance of Borobudur, and the late checkout is perfect for spending the morning at the temple. Good, cheap Indonesian food available until 21:00. Organizes tours for Hill sunrise view on Borobudur (Rp 130,000) and offers a 15% discount on the temple entrance fee. Possibility to book the sunrise entrance for Rp 380,000.

name: St. Camillus Dormitel
address: 3rd Floor, SPMC Cooperative Building, Southern Philippines Medical Center (aka Davao Medical Center) Compound, Bajada
overview: Best value accommodation in Davao City. Airconditioned rooms, quiet location, short walk to all modes of public transport, owners and staff are helpful and very friendly. The dormitel occupies the whole third flood of the building (you can ask permission to go up the rooftop for a breathe of fresh air). Each no-frills room have four double-decker beds, with common tables and a (very) small cabinet for your more important stuff. Toilets/shower-stalls are clean and well lighted. Separate facilities for men and women. The ground floor of the building is occupied by various establishments: laundry shop (18₱/kg), food center, vendors and a popular Chinese fast food chain. The second floor is occupied by an internet cafe and spa/parlor. Tip: call for reservations well ahead of time as they opten fill-up pretty quickly with various traveller groups.

name: Union Street Inn
overview: Edwardian home with spacious airy rooms and a quaint cottage garden in the back.

name: Planet Hotel
overview: Modern and marginally maintained hotel which is convenient for airport. Wireless internet works well, air conditioners do not.  Rooms are generally clean and have TV with a few English channels. If you need entertainment, there is a nightclub across the street.

name: Korona Hotel
overview: *** Is situated in the centre of the city became famous among tourists aiming to visit the eastern part of the country, and among the more and more numerous internal and foreign businessmen. 35 air-conditioned rooms. Mobile: + 3620-2189667. - Events Halls: Kodály Hall with 80-90 seats, the Rendezvény hall (for 120 people) with a stage and gallery - Connection with the event, call: István Szilágyi +36 70 5552138,

name: Casa Divanga
overview: Divanga's little sister at one block down. You get access to Divanga's pool. Shady patio and communal kitchen. Spanish courses available. Includes a tourism information point with Taganga's map and full information about Tayrona park.

name: Erhardt Restaurant and Pansion
overview: cozy wine cellar, and a pleasant garden. - 9 rooms. Guests can park in its parking-place in Halász street 7. - Service: concerts- or theatrical evenings tickets, chocolate- and wine tasting or excursions. Rooms are with: ergonomic mattress, LCD-TV, air conditioning, a bathroom with a bathtub or shower for each room, towel, safe box. Upon request, Provide: babybed extra bed, wireless internet HUF500.

name: Swissôtel Hotels & Resorts: The Bosphorus
overview: A 5-star hotel near Taksim Square with four restaurants and two bars.

name: Star Beach Hotel
overview: Non-air conditioned room ground floor 800 Rupiya, worm and old rooms. Air conditioned rooms first floor 1600 Rupiya.

name: Bhiman Inn
overview: This boutique hotel, with a rather odd logo, is a sister hotel of the Viengtai and is a bit cheaper. It is a fifteen-minute walk north of Khao San Road. Staff friendly, good swimming pool, but poor breakfast offering very little choice.

name: Beats Hostel Sao Paulo
overview: Party Hostel. Come here to have a beer and a good time, not just for sleeping. Bar open until 01:00am, and free shots every night! Go out with staff to discover the ins and out of this Humongopolis.

name: Copenhagen Plaza
overview: 4 Star hotel, right at the exit of the central station, with Tivoli across the street. Classical interiors, and a lot of history.

name: Old Town Hostel
overview: Helpful staff and good common space and kitchen with computers and wi-fi.

name: Comfort Suites
overview: Indoor pool, fitness center, high speed internet, free breakfast available. No smoking, no pets.

name: Luna Hotel
overview: A 3-star hotel built in 2001.There's a fair selection of "real" Hungarian restaurants, bars and stores nearby with prices far below those in the city center.

name: Super 8
overview: Free Wi-Fi Internet and continental breakfast.

name: Youth Hostel Frankfurt
overview: The official youth hostel of Hostelling International and the German branch. Prices are lower with HI membership but its open for all travellers. Dorms, family and single rooms.

name: Mindemoya Court Cottages and Campground
overview: Daily and Weekly Cottage rentals. Full service Campground. Boat rentals, Fishing, Swimming, Hiking, weekly activities. 20 Acres of privacy. 3 minutes to full service town of Mindemoya. Open May 15-Oct. 15 Your hosts...John, Doris, and Greg Adams

name: Thöles Stadt-gut-Hotel garni
overview: This hotel was newly built in 2011 and is located in the centre of Verden next to the main pedestrian street.  There is free car parking at the hotel.

name: Six Senses Zighy Bay
overview: The best resort in the area with amazing luxurious facilities. You need a 4x4 to get to the resort or you can go by speed boat from Dibba in 10-15 minutes.

name: Ideal
overview: +phone=+380 97 531931. Bar, kitchen with room-service, laundry, 24/7, car park, taxi order, Wi-Fi

name: Csőszkunyhó Pansion and Restaurant
overview: Restaurant parts: cellar room, lunchroom. Open: M-Th 11.30-22.00, F-Sa 11.30-23.00, Su 11.30-04.00; Delivery M-F 10.00-22.00. Wi-Fi. - Rooms with bathroom, refrigerator and TV.

name: Vali's non smoking homestay
address: 38th (Farsi:۳۸) alley (previously 6th) off Malakoshoaraye Bahar street (previously Engelab Eslami street), house 277 (Farsi:۲۷۷)
overview: Vali is a carpet merchant and a regional guide but most of all a chatterbox! (he speaks English and basic French) His wife cooks delicious meals which you can enjoy sitting on the terrace. Two bedrooms and an extremely comfortable dorm are available in the basement full of Persian rugs with a basic shared bathroom. The setting is simple but cozy and there is a warm family atmosphere. Internet and Wi-Fi. Lots of tourist information (Vali can help you to sort your visa for Turkmenistan). Hikes and excursions can be organized for one or more days in the villages and mountains surrounding Mashhad. (to help you find Vali's place copy this Farsi phrase and show it around: بین چهاره راه لشکر و استانداری ملکا اشعرابهار ۳۸ شماره۲۷۷ ولی انصاری).

name: Hotel La Villa
overview: Situated 2 km away from the city center. Built in 2013 in the surroundings of Shkugëz forest, suitable for relaxing although weekend summer nights can be loud due to wedding parties. '''Services:'''WiFi Internet access, restaurant, pool, bar, parking.

name: Ramada Vancouver Hotel
overview: Accommodation includes full hot breakfast, adjacent fitness center, business center, guest laundry/dry cleaning service, 24hr concierge, complimentary wifi and baggage storage. The hotel is pet friendly and also has an on-site bar and lounge. Some rooms have kitchenettes.

name: Motel One Munich South
overview: Highly standardised budget hotel with good location to get into town. In walking distance to the Zoo and other local sights. Well booked during Wiesn.

name: Canada's Best Value Princeton Inn & Suites
overview: Outdoor pool, sauna, free continental breakfast.

name: Timandra Motel
overview: The Timandra Motel is a quiet yet centrally located motel at the end of Timandra Street, a no exit road just off State Highway 3.  The motel has extensive gardens and offers a mixture of 1 & 2 bedroom en-suite accommodation, suitable for individuals, couples or family groups.

name: Tsuyama Central Hotel Townhouse
overview: Business hotel with a nearby annex if it's over-booked. Also offers LAN Internet access. Cross the river in front of the station and head up to the second traffic light on the main street.

name: The Ottawa Marriott Hotel
overview: The Ottawa Marriott Hotel is in downtown Ottawa one block from the Parliament Buildings and steps away from museums and shopping. This Ottawa hotel includes a revolving restaurant, Kids’ Zone as well as an indoor pool, sauna and fitness centre.

name: Hyatt Place Albuquerque Uptown
overview: Nice chain motel located in the Uptown area, right across the street from the ABQ Uptown mall.

name: Oakfield B&B
address: 1 Oakfield Terrace, Varteg Road, Blaenavon, Torfaen, NP4 9DS
overview: Family run friendly bed and breakfast accommodation in the World Heritage Site

name: Jardim das Velas
overview: A Mediterranean-style lodge on the beach front.  There are 12 rooms in total, 6 with an ocean view, and 6 on the ground floor.  No restaurant, so no breakfast available. But bars and restaurants are not far away.

name: The Kosmonaut Hostel
address: 4 Tomashivskoho St., apt. 5 (Second Floor) - вулиця Томашівського, 4, кв. 5
overview: 20 beds, 24 hour reception, English speaking staff. Free Wi-Fi, tea, coffee, washing machine, rated the Best Hostel in Ukraine by Hostelworld.com 2008. For good reason too. With a central location, hot powerful showers and a friendly common room perfect for meeting other travellers, this hostel has it all. Some additional attractions like ''bania'', AK-47 shooting trips etc. Staff are very helpful.

name: Hotel Merbabu
overview: Single bed to family room for 4 people. A/C, telephone, TV, indoor bathroom, hot water. Refrigerator for deluxe rooms and above. Strategic location in Jl Pemuda next to Paragon City Mall.

name: Stadshotel Allicht
overview: This "cityhotel" in the popular Bergen-area is nicely decorated and offers comfortable rooms. The restaurant downstairs is divided in two: a "brasserie" with terrace in the front and a more upper class (and more expensive!) restaurant in the back. The brasserie offers better value for your money, but the restaurant food is descent too. If traveling with a car, ask for a parking place when booking.

name: Elm Street Inn
overview: Built c. 1835. Tastefully decorated with period antiques. Three Bedrooms: one king size, one queen size, with en suite bathrooms plus a fully contained carriage house apt. adjacent. Built for Bartholomew Manlove, first mayor of Bastrop and later lived in by Margaret Wilbarger Chambers - legendary pioneer. Located in town, walking distance to shops, restaurants, activities.

name: Miguel Hotel
overview: A new boutique hotel in a renovated building across from the breathtaking view of the Mediterranean. All rooms include a/c, TV, free tea and coffee, refrigerator and have clean and spacious bathrooms; some rooms have a sea view. Wireless internet is available at the entrance floor free of charge. At the entrance floor there is a gourmet restaurant and a high standard bar. The hotels location enables you a short walk to the beach, shopping areas and nightlife attractions. Rates from $104.

name: San Francisco
overview: Nice campsite with pipes with flowing water, covered table with benches and covered place for tents. The toilet may be a bit inconvenient for some people to access. The owner runs a little shop with few goods to eat and drink and if you ask him, you can also use his little kitchen.

name: Fastbook Hostel
overview: A small hostel with 6 private rooms including bathrooms, but separate toilets, and a short walk from the Air Itam town centre. Rooms include air conditioning and TV. There is also a communal washer/dryer, refrigerator, microwave and toaster available. There is no signboard for the hostel, but look out for Gops Cafe, with a big pink signboard, which is located next door.

name: White Cedar Inn B&B
overview: This B&B provides a full breakfast each morning in the sunroom overlooking the gardens. A/C, fireplaces, private baths, non-smoking inn. Free parking and WiFi.

name: Malye Karely
overview: Located near the Malye Korely museum, 24 km from city center, this hotel offers both room and cottage accommodation, as well as handful of daily activities like skiing in winter etc.

name: Loro Loco Hostel
address: Avenida Suarez Arana 134, entre primer y segundo anillo
overview: A brand new hostel in Santa Cruz which offers a laid-back and relaxed atmosphere for backpackers and other travelers. WiFi, garden, small pool and BBQ area.

name: Hotel Ascot
overview: In the center of Milan, just a few meters from Corso di Porta Romana and 10 minutes walk from the Duomo and the National University.

name: Hotel Eta
overview: +Tel: + 36 83 311095. - The rooms there is a beautiful view on the park and lake Balaton.The number of the rooms are 50 with fridge and bathroom with shower. - There is a restaurant and bar open every day 07.00- 21.00. - Buffet breakfast is included in the price of the room. - Lunch and dinner can be provided as set meals. -Also here a Conference room for up to 80 persons. - The garden surrounded by a fence in which there are sport facilities, four beautiful gravel tennis courts, a mini golf course and table tennis. - There is a terrace for sun bathing and a barbecue, also plenty of parking places.

name: Novotel Den Haag Centrum
overview: Located in the Passage shopping centre and literally right across the street from the Binnenhof.

name: Grand Hotel
overview: The Grand Hotel is the oldest hotel in Lodz. 81 rooms including 7 apartments.

name: Fat Yogis
overview: Decent standard budget accommodation 300 m from Kuta Beach.

name: Ibus Hotel
overview: A budget hotel from a major international hotel chain.

name: UR-Edessa Konukevi
address: Yusufpaşa Mahallesi Sarayönü Caddesi 889 Sokak No:4
overview: Housed in a mansion dating back to 18th century.

name: West Usk Lighthouse
overview: Built in 1821, now a hotel.

name: Grand Hotel Adriatico
overview: Modern 4-star hotel in the historical centre.

name: Grand Hotel Beijing
address: 35 East Chang'an Street (东长安街35号; Dōngchángānjiē)
overview: Five-star hotel located in a traditional building in a small street overlooking the Forbidden City. Rooms with free internet except for the cheapest ones. The rooms are 32-66m2 except for the very most expensive, which is more than 100sqm. Business center, gift shop, ticket office, fitness, pool and sauna available. Chinese and Western restaurants as well as coffee shop, bar and room service.

name: The Scarlet
overview: Beyond mere boutiqueness, this "personality hotel" in a stretch of converted shophouses is stuffed with more red plush and gold trim than a Parisian boudoir and does its best to encourage all 7 deadly sins with restaurant Desire, bar Bold, spa Sanctum and gym Flaunt. Rooms are small but comfortable, good location right next to Maxwell Food Centre and the heart of Chinatown.

name: Greenwich Inn
overview: Budget hotel with free parking, located just one block from Union St. It has 32 recently renovated guest rooms and offers an in-room coffee service and a complimentary newspaper daily.

name: Hafod Hotel
overview: Historic hotel originally built as a hunting lodge in 1700's, over looking the Devil's Bridge Falls. Offers accommodation, tea rooms, restaurant and bar for guests, visitors and locals.

name: Chez Francois Bed and Breakfast
overview: Located in the lower Plateau area, close to Duluth restaurants, Saint-Laurent nightlife and more. Five rooms in a typical Montreal walk up, lovingly maintained by Francois, an accommodating host who has excellent suggestions for tourists, as well as preparing wonderful complimentary breakfasts. Free parking available.

name: easyHotel den Haag
overview: easyHotels are a sister hotel chain to the no-frills airline easyJet, and run along similar principles - only the accommodation in the (very simple) rooms are included in the base price, and everything else is charged extra. The location, however, is really central, although do note that the front faces the busy Parkstraat with trams.

name: Campanile Paris XV - Tour Eiffel
overview: English & Spanish spoken at reception.

name: Barentsburg Hotel
overview: Reasonably new (1988) and in fairly good shape.

name: HomeGrown HideAways
overview: A privately owned campground located on working farm.  RV and tent sites with electric and water hookups are available.  The campground has a bathhouse with flush toilets and showers are available April through October.  No pets are allowed and cell phone service is unreliable.

name: El Habib
overview: 4* hotel.

name: Hotel Marina Copán
overview: Located in the center of town, a family owned and operated property established in 1945, this hotel is known for its history, nice architecture and good services. It has 49 rooms.

name: Ceylan Intercontinental
overview: The Ceylan Intercontinental Hotel brags 5-star ambiance with the best address in the city. I can attest that the bar is very stunning in the evening (with stunning views of the Ayasofia and the Blue Mosque in the distance). The three restaurants are mediocre.

name: Hotel Al Corso
overview: It is located in the center of Legnano.

name: Grand Hotel Emerald
overview: Luxurious five-star hotel. Located within few-minute walk from Moskovsky Railway Station and Nevsky Prospekt. Hosts several restaurants, SPA, Top Gym fitness centre and conference facilities.

name: Prescott Inn & Suites Conference Center
overview: Free breakfast and wi-fi, gym, and pool.

name: Hassayampa Inn
overview: This historic hotel has hosted the likes of Georgia O'Keeffe, D.H. Lawrence, Clark Gable, Greta Garbo, and Will Rogers, and is widely believed to be haunted. Pets accepted for no extra charge, free wi-fi, restaurant onsite.

name: Campanile Hotel Luxembourg Aéroport
overview: The Luxembourg Airport Campanile is relatively new and offers the familiar basic comforts to motorized travellers.

name: YHA Taupo
overview: Reception hours: summer 7:30AM-8:30PM

name: Pulaski County Park
overview: A county park located on the shore of Lake Cumberland. The campground features 46 campsites with electric hook ups, shower houses, hiking trails, a disc golf course, and picnic areas.

name: Roper Lake State Park
overview: Has individual sites for RVs, trailers, and tents, as well as cabins for rent. Reservations must be made two weeks in advance. For the park description see listing above in 'Do'.

name: La Maison Rouge
overview: Open all year, with lower prices in effect during the offseason. A charming youth hostel centrally located in a historic farmhouse dating back to 1872, with seven private rooms in the main house as well as four shared dormitories (men's, women's and two mixed) in the barn out back. Three of the private rooms have their own bathroom while the other four split two between them; all are decorated in period style. Those staying in the dormitory can bring their own sleeping bag or rent bedding for $5/nt. Guests have access to a communal living room, sunroom, terrace and kitchen. Internet access is available.

name: Riad Kettani
overview: Riad in the Medina. Has Hammam

name: YMCA
overview: An extremely drab and dark hotel that appears not to have received a lick of paint since its founding in the mid 19th century. However, in someways, that is the hotel's distinctive charm, and so it may appeal to strict traditionalists. There is a simple restaurant on the second floor. The food is nothing special, but the balcony offers a great view of the buzzing city below.

name: Kisiwa Guest House Lodge
overview: Singles and doubles. Free parking, which has to be reserved beforehand. Rates include breakfast and the rooms are equipped with a minibar and a tv. According to their home page rates for longer stays can be negotiated.

name: Motherland Inn 2
overview: Room prices have gone up significantly. Expensive for a guesthouse but still a popular backpacker's place with private and shared baths, and on-site restaurant. They offer free pickup and drop-off from the airport with an early morning breakfast. A long walk or short taxi journey from the city centre. Otherwise the rooms start from USD27 single (fan, shared bath). Seems past its prime, and the low ceiling rooms are sometimes without windows. Internet is MYK1,000/h. A cheaper option is the Internet cafe opposite.

name: Familia Pension
overview: Services: Camping; Free movement for physically handicapped; Free of charge, closed and secured parking place; Grill party facilities; Sauna; Locally Swedish massage (60 min: HUF3900, 30 min. HUF1900), parked courtyard with swimming pool, deckchairs, grill and cooking equipment. Rooms with central heating, bathroom and cable television.- Breakfast: HUF1 000 p.p.

name: Severin Sea Lodge
overview: Pool, sauna, tennis, gym, wellness center

name: Park Inn by Radisson München Frankfurter Ring
address: At the Frankfurter Ring U-Bahn station of the U2
overview: Older and worn hotel in Milbertshofen.

name: Serrano Hotel
overview: This is a deluxe boutique hotel in a 17-story Spanish Revival building. They have free high speed internet and a wine appreciation hour every evening.

name: Ty Newydd Leisure Park
overview: family run caravan park

name: Shangri-La Jakarta
overview: Located within the BNI 46 complex, nestled slightly behind the strip. The Asian chain hotel has 661 spacious rooms, all with stunning views of the city. The 6 restaurants and a New York style bar should not be missed. The Satoo even has a special station for herb drinks (the Indonesian ''jamu'')! Even the locals do sometimes pay a visit to eat.

name: Hotel Charles
overview: - János Restaurant (five star?) serving rich buffet breakfast at 7AM. - At noon: Hungarian dishes (goulash soup, veal paprikash), fish specialities, Italian pasta recipes, special chocolate cakes, and the ever popular Wiener Schnitzel. Room types: Standard studio, Deluxe studio, Deluxe Apartman. 73 rooms 160 beds.

name: Notthingham Square
overview: Welcome to our two bedroom apartment, situated in the newly developed Royal Ascot estate in Milnerton. With central Cape Town & V&A Waterfront a 15 minutes drive away, and only 5 minutes from Tables Bays beaches, it is located in an ideal area.

name: Maison 140 Beverly Hills
overview: Slip into the French and Far East-inspired modes of Maison 140, an intimate, 43-room boutique luxury hotel in Beverly Hills. This unique unique hotel was redesigned by Kelly Wearstler Interior Design as a contemporary tribute to the classic Parisian inns of the last century. Visually striking, yet inviting and warm - the Maison 140 Beverly Hills Hotel is the city's perfect pied-a-terre for the imaginative traveler.

name: Ocean Park Motel
overview: 1930's 'Art Deco' motel. Just a short stroll to the beach and San Francisco Zoo.

name: Ramada Victoria Hotel
overview: Meeting & banquest rooms, business center, seasonal pool, complimentary internet, free parking, kitchenette suites, pet friendly

name: Hotel Room
overview: Hotel Room is actually not a hotel, but a funkily furnished 30 sq.m. flat in the Kallio district.

name: Hotel El Tajo
overview: Has on-site restaurant and bar, free wi-fi.

name: AVA Hotelli
overview: Affordable hotel in Kumpula, popular among Russian visitors.

name: Hampton Inn, Beale Street
overview: This is right on Beale Street--as opposed to the Holiday Inn and the Peabody, both of which are a few blocks away. The room prices are average, but beware: it ''is'' noisy. If you want to party then this is the place, but for a quieter getaway, stay a few blocks away.

name: Pension Breza
overview: This family-owned pension is walking distance away from the center of the city, with a friendly and comfortable atmosphere. +Моbile.:+389 71 214 071

name: Ekeberg Camping
overview: Open 1 Jun–1 Sep. The closest campsite to central Oslo. Beautiful view of the city. No cabins. Owned by the Norwegian Automobile Federation. Mini-golf and horse rental. Fully equipped sanitary facilities: showers with hot and cold water, toilets, kitchen, launderette.

name: Le Mirage
overview: Open Jun-Oct. A large hotel south of the town centre, all of whose 67 rooms are decorated in a country theme and boast private balconies with ocean views. Outdoor pool and tennis court open seasonally. Front desk is staffed 24 hours a day and will arrange boat tours to the national park on request. Property is handicapped accessible. No pets allowed.

name: The LA Hotel Downtown
overview: Has a small older theater in its basement where you can still see first-run movies for under $8.

name: El Portal Sedona Luxury Hacienda and Restaurant
overview: The architecture and adobe construction of El Portal is completely authentic. Nowhere else in Sedona will you find a luxury inn or hotel with 18-inch thick adobe walls— walls that provide both quiet and history. Twelve spacious rooms have been created in accordance with the simplicity and function of turn-of-the-century architecture.

name: Grand Hotel Bellevue
overview: The hotel has excellent views over the wide Moldefjord - and fine meals, buffet and set in different restaurants.

name: Hotel Napoleon
address: Piazza Vittorio Emanuele II, 105 00185, Rome, Italy
overview: Four star hotel, 75 rooms with private bathrooms, bar and restaurant, free internet wi-fi, transfer from Airports, located in Piazza Vittorio Emanuele II, in the middle of Rione Esquilino, one metro stop from Termini Station and from San Giovanni.

name: Fontecruz Lisboa
overview: Striking postmodern architecture and interior appointments are on the menu throughout this Marriott's luxury boutique hotel.

name: Orchard View Country House
address: On the R331, 3km west of Patensie
overview: Self-Catering or (Dinner), Bed&Breakfast with a nice view over the Gamtoos Valley and Patensie.

name: Hotel Eldorado
overview: The Eldorado, a former ''maison de rendez-vous'', was once home to the kept women of the 19th century bourgeois. Now a very cute ''no'' star hotel, its charm more than makes up for what it lacks in amenities (who needs a TV in Paris anyway?). The  staff are super friendly, the décor is garage sale chic, and there's a lovely courtyard that fills with neighbourhood hipsters on warm evenings. It also has a very good location and you can easily avoid the noise of Pigalle or Montmartre's high prices, but they're within stumble distance if you decide to explore. For early risers breakfast (€5, until 10:00) is served in the attached restaurant/bar. Some English spoken, especially for those who pet the cat sprawled across the reception desk.

name: Tavan Bogd Hotel
address: Located across from the Kazakh Theater
